TEXT_CHA_AR_5_29_DESC.text: Despite the other warriors' initial disapproval of her methods, it is Ran's deadly assassinations of important enemy figures that manage to turn the tide of war in every battle. The mercenary band to which the assassin belongs grows more and more famous with every victory she brings, until they increase multiple times their original size. Yet the mercenary captain, fearful that Ran's existence will bring danger to them in the end, secretly attempts to kill her. Ran only barely manages to escape. A fateful blizzard erases her tracks and Ran manages to thwart her pursuers, but her near-fatal wound hinders her steps until she finds she cannot go any further before the cold-hearted winter winds. Before she grows unconscious, the last thing she sees is a black crow with a face of ivory white approaching her with soft, gentle steps.

TEXT_CHA_AR_5_30_DESC.text: After years of effort, Aurea becomes the youngest member in Elvish history to join the Golden Archers. Her talents are promptly acknowledged, and she soon becomes appointed as Magnus’s Vice Captain. Aurea worries over her new promotion as her Captain is known to discriminate those outside nobility. She quickly realizes, however, that the rumors are false, and Magnus appreciates her worth for what it is, regardless of her past.

TEXT_CHA_AR_5_31_DESC.text: How can he win? As Meleager sulks over his endless series of defeats, a mysterious woman furtively approaches the young hunter. She asserts that it is against “the natural order” that a noble should lose to a lowly commoner, and passes to him ‘Salamander,’ a fire spirit. The Salamander, only visible to Meleager, infuses the hunter’s arrows with explosive flames that accelerate, strengthen, and correct his shots. Meleager signs up for the next hunt with newfound confidence.

TEXT_CHA_AR_5_32_DESC.text: Even the slums could not escape the flames of war. As days of chaos and disorder continue, the members of the Scrappy Gang disband and scatter. With the whereabouts of her best friends now unknown, Miel joins the revolutionary army instead. She recalls all the TV broadcasts that she has watched with her friends and develops a type of explosive arrow with the knowledge and skills she has accumulated throughout the years. Miel’s arrows are found to be suitable for attacking the mechanical weaponry of the Neth Army, and Miel herself wins many a battle from the rear with her excellent sniping skills.

TEXT_CHA_AR_5_33_DESC.text: Iris turns her attention to the magic portals that are controlled by each nation for transport. What if people could use the portals not only for travel, but also for commerce—for delivering cargo around the world? Teleport magic, an advanced form of magic that required enormous power and so could only be activated by tapping into the ley lines of the continent, could be simplified by narrowing its target. Through inherent talent, perseverance, and – more than anything – thinking outside the box, Iris succeeds in teleporting small parcels through downsized portals. When she visits Arche to thank her for her advice, the other witch recognizes the massive potential in Iris’s magic and proposes that they start a new delivery service brand together. Shortly thereafter, Iris and Arche co-found the ‘Rainbow Delivery,’ which revolutionizes the logistics of Pumpkin City.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_22_DESC.text: Realizing that the monster attack is her ultimate opportunity to escape, Genevie attempts to flee in the midst of the uproar. However, when she hears the scream of a child trapped before a vicious monster, Genevie finds herself hesitating between the child and the pathway to her freedom. Another desperate scream startles her into action, and she turns away from her escape route to rapidly draw her bow. It is only after she returns to the town, the child safe in her arms and people praising her with every step, that she realizes the magnitude of her actions. How will she ever leave, now that she is the new hero of the town?

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_23_DESC.text: After wandering throughout the lands and defeating many beasts that cross his path, Panpan hears of a Rabbit Princess who rules over a small mountain. Panpan challenges the Princess to a duel, which continues for a week to the Panda's utter defeat. Finding himself once more at the foot of the mountain, Panpan thinks of his beloved son and vows that he will never give up until he is cured.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_24_DESC.text: Athena understands the extent of Arachne's strength at a glance and asks the hunter to join her forces. Arachne, grateful for being accepted without prejudice, accepts the offer and swears to stay by Athena's side to the end. Having shed the fear that had held her back, Arachne fully turns into the Spider Queen: the deadly beauty and Athena's champion, vanquishing all foes that dare step into her web.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_25_DESC.text: Lindsey's father, having quietly watched Lindsey strive for her dream, finally gives his own advice to his beloved daughter: that the right to prove her own worth belongs to her and her alone, and that no form of prejudice can define her. Lindsey, her determination renewed by her father's words, receives the mechanical bow and explosive arrows that her father crafted just for her. She starts for the Desert by herself, and it is not long before wanted criminals begin to cower before the girl now called 'the Lone Wolf,' the renowned sheriff of Trista and a symbol of hope to everyone with a dream.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_26_DESC.text: The moment her fingers graze over the pearl within the shell, Haerang regains the memories of her past life and true identity: the Oracle of Water, the fabled guardian of the mythical seas of the East. After her previous death centuries ago, she had attempted to reincarnate with her memories intact - but had failed to do so due to the interference of one sinister being. After realizing the immense truth, Haerang runs back to the cottage by the sea to reveal the news to the elderly couple. Yet only the sight of an old, derelict house greets her, and the ocean quietly calls her name.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_28_DESC.text: Malkah grows up to become the best snake charmer in the Woopa Tribe. Having finally made peace with the fact that Mamba is never going to return, Malkah devotes her heart to the village... until Mamba returns with people from foreign lands. The bewildered Malkah, her heart beating furiously, attempts to greet Mamba, but her childhood sweetheart passes by without recognizing her. Malkah realizes that Mamba has forgotten her and their childhood promise, and she feels a new rage consuming her heart.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_29_DESC.text: A few days later, Ran regains consciousness in an old inn at Snorri Edda. She attempts to find her missing savior in order to thank him, only to hear from the innkeeper that a man in a white crow mask brought her in, tended to her wounds, and then disappeared. A freshly revived Ran also catches the news that her entire band of mercenaries, including the captain who attempted to murder her, was annihilated in the middle of a particularly difficult maneuver. Ran, complicated emotions running through her heart, finally comes to fully despise the Nosgardian warriors' self-destructive, violent desire for honor in battle. The assassin returns to the battlefield, intent on punishing those undeserving souls by bestowing upon them 'dishonorable' deaths. After crafting a white crow mask in the likeness of that of her savior's, Ran, now called the White Raven, disappears into the darkness of Snorri Edda.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_30_DESC.text: As she continues to assist Magnus in his duties, Aurea begins to feel herself attracted by Magnus’s elegance and celebrated competence. When she repeatedly witnesses her usually perfect Captain falling apart before Sigruna, Aurea becomes overwhelmed with jealousy. Yet by a twist of fate, she comes to discover that the unknown benefactor from her childhood was, in fact, Sigruna. Her mind in chaos, torn between her feelings towards Magnus and deep gratitude towards her rival, Aurea endlessly asks herself what she must do.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_31_DESC.text: The day of the hunt dawns over Roman, and Meleager easily shoots down his prey with Salamander’s aid. All seems to be going well – until a powerful blaze suddenly erupts from Salamander and engulfs everything in a scorching inferno. While Meleager, shocked by the abrupt chaos that he has invoked, struggles to restore order, Atalante triumphantly catches a lion and wins the hunt yet again. To make things worse, the furious Ares banishes Meleager after their family vaults are emptied to pay for reparations. Kicked out of his family home, lost, and deathly afraid of Salamander’s flames that grow stronger daily, Meleager decides that he must first and foremost track down the woman who gave him the fire spirit if he is to ever recover his honor.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_32_DESC.text: After the end of the war, Miel becomes a regular member of the Neth Empire Interim Government Army. Before the end of four years, another war led by the conglomerates of Neth Empire breaks out, and Miel returns to the battlefield. However, her explosive arrows prove to be no match against the enemy mechanized units recently improved with a new technology called ‘Magic Engineering.’ During her struggles in battle, Miel encounters a stranger who claims she has come from another dimension. The stranger, who for some unknown reason reminds Miel of her old friends in the Scrappy Gang, suggests some improvements to Miel’s arrows. The resulting ‘EMP arrows,’ which can silence the enemy with a single deadly shot from the shadows, become the weapon most feared by the Magic Engineering troops. A bounty is placed on Miel's head by Pursuit Commander Svenja.

TEXT_CHA_AR_6_33_DESC.text: Rainbow Delivery comes to dominate the tightknit sector of delivery services. As business expands, so too does the scope of decisions that must be made. Iris, an ordinary girl who knows not much outside her magic research, becomes overwhelmed by the ever-increasing workload. Arche sees Iris’s agitation and offers to fully manage the business, which would allow Iris to solely focus on her research. Iris gratefully accepts the deal. Then one day, after weeks and months of penning herself up in her laboratory, Iris witnesses a protest of other delivery witches outside. After Iris entrusted the business to Arche, Rainbow Delivery had effectively monopolized the delivery businesses of Pumpkin City, upsetting the fine ecosystem of businesses. Iris hurries to the Rainbow Delivery offices and searches for Arche to ask for an explanation but discovers that her former business partner has fled with all the money. At that moment, creditors besiege the office, clamoring for a return of their investments. The bewildered Iris runs away, holding only her bag of research data.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_BEARS_4_BERA_DESC.text: With the falling of autumn leaves begins the salmon run, the spawning season for salmon, in the upper reaches of the river near the southeastern borders of Nosgard. Not only is the salmon that migrate back to Nosgard abundant enough to feed all the hungry bears of the borderlands, but they are also full of selenium and other nutrients accumulated while traveling through the 'mystical seas'. The auspicious magic of the sea, coupled with copious amounts of vitamins and antioxidants in salmon, temporarily endows bears with unusually high intelligence. Bera... is NOT one of those bears who, while devouring fish after fish, became fully aware of her own self-consciousness.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_BEARS_5_BERA_DESC.text: Born with extremely high intelligence, Bera the bear considers it her responsibility to lead her pack to the southeastern river every autumn to feast on the migrating salmon. After creating a makeshift dam to obstruct the salmon’s journey, Bera cleverly lures the fish in the direction of her bear-kin with her bow and bait, expediting the other bears’ fishing. At times, she fights back humans from ‘stealing’ any of the bountiful salmon. Although she suffers injuries big and small in the process, Bera does not mind the arduous labor. If it means she can hold intelligent conversations with her temporarily smarter comrades every autumn, short as the blessing may last - then her pain is certainly worth it.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_BEARS_6_BERA_DESC.text: One ill-fated autumn, Bera fails to find any salmon swimming up the river. Scouting her surroundings, the perplexed bear soon discovers the reason of the shortage: a nefarious monster of a machine invented by ‘Beron,’ a loner who has always distanced himself from the rest of the pack. Bera, furious that Beron would hog all the salmon for his selfish wish of keeping his intelligence forever, charges at the other bear. Beron reveals himself to be no easy match, however, equipped as he is with the advanced technology of Neth Empire. Bera has no choice but to retreat for the time being… but she still succeeds in breaking into Beron’s warehouse and stealing piles of salmon for her bear-kin. From that day on, the two bears become sworn enemies, and it is said that they fight a bloody battle every year on the banks of the Nosgard River.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_ER_4_07_DESC.text: The seventh member of the Eto Rangers, Pakaracchi. Has a very active and tenacious personality. Whether it be by fighting off the Jyarei Monsters threatening Novel Worlds, or by giving courage to his friends who lack it, he protects the Novel Worlds with the rest of the Eto Rangers.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_ER_5_07_DESC.text: The seventh member of the Eto Rangers, Pakaracchi. Has a very active and tenacious personality. Whether it be by fighting off the Jyarei Monsters threatening Novel Worlds, or by giving courage to his friends who lack it, he protects the Novel Worlds with the rest of the Eto Rangers.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_ER_6_07_DESC.text: The seventh member of the Eto Rangers, Pakaracchi. Has a very active and tenacious personality. Whether it be by fighting off the Jyarei Monsters threatening Novel Worlds, or by giving courage to his friends who lack it, he protects the Novel Worlds with the rest of the Eto Rangers.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_GOGI_4_ALMAEL_DESC.text: The ambitious Almael has always dreamt of leaving her quiet village to roam the wide world and achieving glorious feats to spread her name. The fairy elders, however, disdainfully scold Almael for her ingratitude to the Beast King, who long ago helped the fairy folk find a new home in the Peaks of Glory. One day, Almael comes across the Fairy Chieftain's daughter grumbling to herself, and hatches a plan to use her to escape the tedium of her small town life.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_GOGI_5_ALMAEL_DESC.text: Almael succeeds in persuading Delrien to conquer the village Main Hall. As she predicted, Delrien storms out of the village, unable to suppress her anger. Almael announces to the fairy elders that she will return with Delrien and gleefully chases after her. However, she has no intention to return any time soon: instead, she will enjoy adventures of her own until she returns to reap in rewards for protecting the Chieftain's daughter. Yet when Almael visits a library in the capital of Roman, she comes to uncover an important secret concerning the fairy folk's history...

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_GOGI_6_ALMAEL_DESC.text: Many years ago, fairies were declared a harmful species by the Roman Olympian Council, who feared them for their magical powers that far outweighed their small stature. It was only by the former Beast King's efforts that the fairy folk avoided mass extinction and safely relocated to the Peaks of Glory. What would humans think if a fairy suddenly appeared declaring that she would defeat the Beast King and conquer the human world? It doesn't seem so farfetched a possibility, Almael thinks, as she stops Delrien from attacking random human passerbys - especially considering the princess's ambitions. Luck has it that a human girl appears before them, calming Delrien and offering the two young fairies to take them to the Beast King. Almael now has a new mission at hand: stop Delrien from waging war with humans, and keep their fairy village safe once and for all!

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_GS_4_06_DESC.text: A cheerful and skilled Silver Rank archer who loves adventure, the High Elf Archer accompanies Goblin Slayer, who is always obsessing over killing all Goblins, to teach him the true joys of adventuring. While helping Goblin Slayer defeat Goblins as usual, the party discovers a Goblin Lord and his horde of Goblins teleporting through a magical mirror to another dimension. Goblin Slayer chases after the Goblins without hesitation, and High Elf Archer has no choice but to follow him through the mirror.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_GS_5_06_DESC.text: A cheerful and skilled Silver Rank archer who loves adventure, the High Elf Archer accompanies Goblin Slayer, who is always obsessing over killing all Goblins, to teach him the true joys of adventuring. While helping Goblin Slayer defeat Goblins as usual, the party discovers a Goblin Lord and his horde of Goblins teleporting through a magical mirror to another dimension. Goblin Slayer chases after the Goblins without hesitation, and High Elf Archer has no choice but to follow him through the mirror.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_GS_6_06_DESC.text: A cheerful and skilled Silver Rank archer who loves adventure, the High Elf Archer accompanies Goblin Slayer, who is always obsessing over killing all Goblins, to teach him the true joys of adventuring. While helping Goblin Slayer defeat Goblins as usual, the party discovers a Goblin Lord and his horde of Goblins teleporting through a magical mirror to another dimension. Goblin Slayer chases after the Goblins without hesitation, and High Elf Archer has no choice but to follow him through the mirror.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_OT_4_05_DESC.text: Age 23, female. A dancer from the entertainment district of the town of Sunshade, located in the Sunlands.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_OT_4_08_DESC.text: Age 26, female. An unmatched hunter from the Woodlands.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_OT_5_05_DESC.text: But in truth, she is a highborn daughter of the once-proud House Azelhart. She has been pretending to be a dancer as a means to track certain people.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_OT_5_08_DESC.text: Her master left home one year ago to hunt a beast known as "Redeye."  「The master only maken me worry, he never changeth. 」

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_OT_6_05_DESC.text: 「Three men bearing the mark of the crow. They took my father from me.」 Then, one day, she spots a certain man at the tavern.

TEXT_CHA_AR_LIMITED_OT_6_08_DESC.text: Then, one day, she is reunited with a monster.

TEXT_CHA_HU_1_11_DESC.text: A craftsman who makes toy guns to pass the time. Immersed in her hobby, she thinks she finally succeeds in making a perfect replica of the most popular model and doesn't realize she made an actual gun…

TEXT_CHA_HU_1_12_DESC.text: A manager of the laboratory in the Temple of Illusions. Strangely enough, despite all her meticulous inspections she simply cannot find a last test subject on the list. Too bad her boss doesn't understand how hard she works.

TEXT_CHA_HU_1_13_DESC.text: If you see a hunter wearing a Deerdog hat in the forests of Nosgard, you know that you have met the Legendary Hunter... Or that's how he introduces himself, anyway. The hunter boasts about his Deerdog hat to everyone he meets, claiming that it is made out of the fabled Deerdog that he caught, but no one has ever seen him actually hunting. There are rumors that the Deerdog hat is a mere replica.

TEXT_CHA_HU_1_14_DESC.text: A soldier who has recently taken her first leave after joining the Neth Army a few months ago. She's indignant that the recent state of affairs in Edenberg has cut her vacation short.

TEXT_CHA_HU_1_15_DESC.text: A mysterious lady that is rumored to be the most beautiful in Chen. There's another rumor that says that she threatens passersby with a gun to spread rumors about her being beautiful.

TEXT_CHA_HU_2_15_DESC.text: An enthusiast of vampire stories. On nights of the full moon, she dresses up as a vampire hunter (to the last detail as written in her books!) and wanders the streets in hopes to catch a glimpse of the fabled species.

TEXT_CHA_HU_2_16_DESC.text: A tomb raider who snuck in the Temple of Illusions with dreams of riches. He became stuck in the Temple after activating a hidden trap.

TEXT_CHA_HU_2_17_DESC.text: An expert of ice fishing. He's looking for undiscovered species under the frozen lakes.

TEXT_CHA_HU_2_18_DESC.text: A science fiction fan widely known in Neth Empire. She is obsessed with the idea of extraterresterial life - to the point that she has developed a special suit to fly in the atmosphere above Hasla, in an attempt to meet her beloved aliens.

TEXT_CHA_HU_2_19_DESC.text: President of the Ethereal Magic Academy. They don't have real research results, but they do like to get together for meals to watch the President show off his special talents.

TEXT_CHA_HU_3_17_DESC.text: A hunter who chases after anything lucrative. Hunting people was too scary for him, so he decided to go after the bounty itself - hence his title, a "bounty hunter."

TEXT_CHA_HU_3_18_DESC.text: A youth who roams the continent of Hasla to "overcome obstacles and become stronger." He received a serious leg injury during his travels, but tends to think of it only as a difficulty he must overcome.

TEXT_CHA_HU_3_19_DESC.text: A poacher who hunts in the forests of Nosgard. He was captured for stealing a gun from the workshop of a certain Frost Elf and indulging in ruthless hunting sprees.

TEXT_CHA_HU_3_20_DESC.text: One of Galatea's clones, specially selected for his dexterity and craftmanship to repair the Ark. He is very proud of his skills.

TEXT_CHA_HU_3_21_DESC.text: A bandit living in the deep valley of Taebaek Mountains. He dreamed of being a pirate, but he hated getting seasick so he became a bandit in the mountains.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_22_DESC.text: A spy of Neth Empire who has received training from his childhood. Acknowledged as one of the best spies in the Empire, Zahard receives a secret mission to investigate the Palace of Chen. Under the disguise of an ordinary transfer student, Zahard leaves for the East.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_23_DESC.text: A natural marksman who was recruited by the Zodiac Army at an early age. When Bellerophon receives an assignment to hunt down a dragon near his hometown, he is elated that he is close to fulfilling his lifelong dream of returning as a glorious and renowned soldier to his hometown. One night, as he keeps watch over the camp, Bellerophon hears a low growl nearby - and discovers a dragon lurking in the darkness. Overcome with awe, he is unable to do anything but watch it fly into the night.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_24_DESC.text: A young man who has grown up in the slums of the Southwestern regions of Hasla. Despising the poverty that permeates his life, Jet tries his hand at every job he can get - but finds himself still destitute. One day, Jet receives advice from a self-proclaimed "bounty hunter" that bounty-hunting should be lucrative enough for his aspirations.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_25_DESC.text: Carol is used to being the best, and she prefers to keep it that way - especially when it comes to fighting with her sword and gun. Second to none, the proud Carol joins the Order of the Goddess to become the best Heaven's Cavalry in Hasla and put her gifts to good use.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_26_DESC.text: An infamous wizard hunter recruited by the Neth Empire for her keen aim and ruthless heart. When she receives orders from Road Industry to capture Sasquatch living in the snowy mountains of Nosgard, Lyudmilla does not ask any questions. But the snowy terrain proves a difficulty for the hunter, who gets trapped under an avalanche and then attacked by monsters. Struggling to keep her eyes open, the wounded Lyudmilla eventually loses consciousness.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_28_DESC.text: The only daughter of a nouveau riche family of Grancia Empire. The center of affection and the money to show it, Cindy becomes a spoiled and pampered child. The only person who can manage her tantrums and fits of rage is 'Jarvis,' Cindy's childhood friend-butler whom she grew up with. It is only through Jarvis's hard work and effort that Cindy manages to control her temper and grow up into a fine lady any noble family would be proud of.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_29_DESC.text: A merchant who travels through mountain villages to sell tteok, traditional rice cakes of the Eastern Kingdom Han. One day, as Malsook walks along a quiet mountain path on her route, an enormous tiger appears before her and blocks her path, roaring, “Give me a piece of tteok or I’ll eat you up!” The stunned Malsook throws the tteok in her basket into the tiger’s mouth, and the tiger retreats with a happy expression. The merchant thanks the heavens for her good luck in coming out unscathed, but when the tiger begins to come and require a piece of tteok every day afterwards, she finds herself concerned over the additional expenses. After much thought, Malsook makes up her mind to take the matter into her hands, and orders a special gun from the gun-makers of a nearby village.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_30_DESC.text: Silver has always been known as "that introverted kid." He would like nothing more than to play "heroes and villains" with the other kids in the neighborhood, but he always shies away before managing to ask them. One day, Silver—while quietly watching the other children play as he does every day— is kidnapped by an anonymous organization. For years, his body becomes the subject of countless experiments, slowly converting into a human weapon. Before he suffers the final experiment that will rob him of his mental autonomy, Silver manages to escape from the laboratory, freed by the chaos brought by the timely onset of war.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_31_DESC.text: After years of studying abroad in Valencia with the unconditional support of her wealthy family, Aramis finally returns to her homeland of Trista. She easily passes the entrance exams of the Musketeers, the elite brigade of the kingdom, and her new position goes unquestioned before her finesse and cool demeanor. Aramis’s younger sister, a gifted dancer, also becomes renowned for her exotic style of traditional Valencian dance; she earns the nickname of ‘Matahari’: the Sun of the Southwest. The fame of the two genius sisters spreads throughout Trista.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_32_DESC.text: A normal girl who dreams of becoming the world's greatest bass player. Jeomrye quickly discovers that her ten fingers and the four steely strings of her guitar aren't enough to dodge the inconveniences of everyday life - including her ever-growing stack of bills and receipts. She finally bends under the pressure and joins 'Cano☆Revolution,' an idol band led by Cano.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_33_DESC.text: Around the Primal Volcano live old indigenous tribes who refuse the pursuit of technological progress and instead live in complete harmony with nature. Each tribe possesses distinctively different beliefs and traditions, but ever since the great eruption of the Volcano, all have gathered under the central leadership of 'Woomparoom Woopa.' Only the 'Coatl' tribe, who serve 'Quaxolotl' the god of death and ashes, remains hostile to the Woopa tribe and disappears into the depths of the jungle. Luca, a member of the Coatl tribe who both envies and respects Woopa, vows to become a greater chieftain and lead his tribe back out of the jungle in glory.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_34_DESC.text: A diligent girl who struggles to overcome her family’s financial difficulties and finally gets accepted to Edenberg National University. Life continues to be difficult, however, and Svenja must work part-time to maintain her schedule as a student. During one of her shifts, she sees one advertisement for the Neth ROTC, which claims that they will sponsor the families of all enlisted soldiers. Svenja volunteers without hesitation and becomes a cadet. For two years she trains in the army, until the Neth War breaks out one day. Due to a shortfall of soldiers, even cadets are sent out to the battlefield, and Svenja is also placed on a tank as a gunner. When her tank commander is killed in a particularly fierce battle, Svenja is made to take command, as matters are urgent. Thus ends Svenja’s life as an ordinary girl, and instead a legendary soldier is born on the battlefield of the Empire.

TEXT_CHA_HU_4_36_DESC.text: An orphan of the Junkyard who scrapes by by collecting and selling scrap metal. Due to her petite stature and frail constitution, Tess is often pushed to the sidelines and bullied by her peers. However, there is one special aspect about the street urchin: her voice. Tess never loses her ground in a quarrel; if she finds herself in an unacceptable situation, her relentless demands and persuasive inquiries tire out not only her bullies but also bystanders into surrendering to her whims. Even when she becomes isolated from everyone, Tess still refuses to give up her difficult ways. Three children watch her closely without her knowing.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_22_DESC.text: Zahard successfully carries out his mission, but discovers that he is being suspected as a double agent of Chen. Fearing for his life, he flees the Empire to the kingdom of Chen.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_23_DESC.text: Bellerophon soon receives news that his hometown has been ravaged by a dragon attack and blames himself for not killing the dragon on sight. Guilt and rage consume the hunter, who swears vengeance on behalf of his village. Bellerophon immerses himself in his job as a monster hunter and slays many fearsome beasts, building a reputation for himself in the meantime. Yet Bellerophon has only one goal in mind: to track down the dragon that nearly destroyed his village and kill it once and for all.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_24_DESC.text: Jet becomes a novice bounty hunter, aspiring to earn enough money to "live a better life somewhere else." His skills are yet crude and unpolished, but his tenacity makes up for the lack of expertise. Once Jet has his eyes on a bounty, he never fails in obtaining it!

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_25_DESC.text: Soon after joining the Order and being drafted into the Heaven's Cavalry, Carol finds out about the position of 'Elite Captain,' a prestigious rank bestowed to the best soldier in the group. While Carol may receive the highest grades, her arrogance and overconfidence always get the best of her. The title of 'Elite Captain' thus goes to Teresa, leaving Carol to seethe over the first 'second place' in which she finds herself.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_26_DESC.text: After regaining her senses, Lyudmilla discovers that she has been rescued by none other than Sasquatch. The hunter raises her hand to attack the innocent young wizard, knock him out, and so finish her mission - but finds, to her acute surprise, that she cannot harm her kind savior. Lyudmilla soon flees and leaves behind Sasquatch and her mission, but not the confusion that she feels for the first time in her heart.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_28_DESC.text: One night at an autumn ball, Cindy's parents attempt to tell their daughter about marriage arrangements that will prove profitable to their family. Cindy, however, furiously declares that she wants to marry Jarvis instead. Cindy's parents, after much deliberation, chase the butler out of their mansion - only to start one of Cindy's famous tantrums. Moments later, she leaves the now disheveled mansion to search for her beloved Jarvis.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_29_DESC.text: When the tiger comes clamoring for his daily piece of tteok the next day, Malsook acquiesces to his demands – before grabbing the gun from her basket and shooting at the tiger. The bullet – specially made out of hardened tteok, Malsook’s own recipe – hits the tiger straight in the mouth. The king of the mountain beasts, however, chews on the tteok bullet and leaves happily. After this day, Malsook and the tiger’s daily repertoire escalates to a whole new level of sweet doom: Malsook continues researching ways to cook up harder and more critical tteok bullets, while the tiger continues enjoying his daily bullet buffet, uninjured and quite content with how things have turned out.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_30_DESC.text: Silver hastily crosses the chaotic battlefield. He realizes that his body is no longer that of an ordinary boy: he can now crush concrete buildings like jelly, freely activate the high-tech gadgets installed into his body, and even transform into a gigantic weapon himself. His monstrous new abilities scare him, and Silver doggedly tries to forget everything that has happened over the years. Yet when he finally returns to his hometown and discovers that his old friends have become the next generation’s Gatcha Rangers, Silver vows that he will use his powers for justice. All the experiments he has undergone has not changed his shy personality, however, and Silver only manages to help his friends from the secret of the shadows. Nobody guesses that “the Loner,” as the Gatcha Rangers have dubbed him, is the boy they once knew.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_31_DESC.text: A few years after joining the Musketeers, Aramis takes her first solo mission: to catch a treacherous spy who has been divulging confidential information from under the cover of the Trista National Dance Company. She swiftly ambushes the secret meeting point—only to discover that the identity of the spy is none other than her younger sister, Matahari. The shocked Aramis only stares as her beloved sister averts her gaze and flees the premises.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_32_DESC.text: Along with the great success of 'Cano☆Revolution, Jeomrye becomes increasingly popular under the stage name 'Miyu.' Yet something is missing from her life, 'Miyu' feels - something that once existed when she was a poor musician living from hand to mouth. Jeomrye, feeling that her life is being wasted only to fuel Cano's career, quits the band to search for her true calling. During her travels, she discovers a small instrument store in a small back alley in Pumpkin City. Her curiosity stimulated by the excess of leather and gas masks decorating the premises, Jeomrye enters the shop.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_33_DESC.text: The Coatl tribe soon faces a crisis in their new village deep in the jungle: the flora and fauna, affected by the power of the Red Lotus that flows from the Primal Volcano, begin to attack them. The warriors of Coatl fall one by one before the relentless onslaughts of hostility, but Luca continues to doggedly defend the village in a last stand. When even Luca falls in danger, giant insects suddenly appear out of nowhere to protect him. Initially shocked and confused by the inexplicable turn of the tide, Luca becomes used to the new voice in his head, following it to command the insects and defeat the possessed creatures of the jungle. The Coatl tribe is enthralled by Luca's newfound powers and, believing that the god Quaxolotl has made Luca his sole messenger and priest, hails him as their new chieftain.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_34_DESC.text: Svenja is promoted to the position of tank platoon commander. Her skillful command leads her troops to victory after victory. However, Svenja discovers that even she cannot stop the Hero of Hasla, bareheaded and completely unprotected, from breaching the lines of her flaming tanks and conquering the battlefield. After Dyke's defeat at Edenberg and the subsequent ending of the war, Svenja is imprisoned on the charge of numerous war crimes. After days of dejection in the Empire's deepest prison cell, Svenja receives a visit from a group of scientists.

TEXT_CHA_HU_5_36_DESC.text: One day, the three children approach Tess and, after introducing themselves as 'the Scrappy Gang,' propose that she come live with them at their secret hideout. Taken aback at the friendly gesture, Tess rejects the offer, but gradually opens up to the Scrappy Gang who visit and take care of her every day. The ragtag community provides the young girl with things she's never had before in her life: peace, happiness, a place to belong, a family... However, good things never last. As time passes and the children grow up, the members of the Scrappy Gang disperse one by one, until the flames of war find only Tess and Miel in their hideout. In the aftermath of the bombing, Tess finds herself alone once more, gaping at the ruins of her home. She must do something to fill the empty hole in her heart... And so Tess volunteers for the Revolutionary Army. Her weak body buckles under her deep-seated rage, however. Tess reminds herself of what her friend of the Scrappy Gang once told her: the pen may be mightier than the sword, but one's own tongue is mightier than any pen!

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_22_DESC.text: Believing that he has been betrayed by Neth Empire, Zahard applies for asylum upon arriving in Chen, using the knowledge he has accumulated from his missions. The Emperor of Chen hears of the spy's request and, interest piqued by his allegations, allows him an audience. Zahard reveals the truth of all that has happened, winning the Emperor's trust. He is granted asylum in Chen, and is later accepted to the Elite Secret Forces. Zahard continues to carry out undercover missions in his new home.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_23_DESC.text: Bellerophon's long-awaited battle with the dragon ends with the hunter's victory. Although Athena offers him a lavish reward and a promotion, Bellerophon decides his path lies in helping others and keeping people from harm. He spends the reward not for himself but for those who have been injured by the dragon. In the end, he leaves the Zodiac Army to walk the path of a dragon hunter and a savior of the people.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_24_DESC.text: Now a living legend among bounty hunters, Jet becomes loaded with not only bullets but an immense fortune that allows him to escape the dreaded slums of his youth. Yet his hunger for money - or perhaps something else - remains unsatiated, and he continues his career as Loaded Jet, the greatest bounty hunter the southwestern lands have ever seen!

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_25_DESC.text: When Teresa suddenly deserts her ranks and leaves the Heaven's Cavalry for good, the empty position of 'Elite Captain' goes to Carol. Although Carol does her best to show that she has every right to her new position, many still remember Teresa as the better soldier and captain. Carol, fed up with her eternal reputation of 'second place,' departs to track down Teresa and end their (rather one-sided) competition once and for all.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_26_DESC.text: After her short but fateful meeting with Sasquatch, Lyudmilla begins to question the cruel nature of her career. While roaming the mountains deep in her thoughts, the hunter comes across Neth soldiers stationed to look into her disappearance and complete her mission. Only a moment's hesitation flickers across Lyudmilla's mind before the hunter aims her gun towards the soldiers to protect Sasquatch and shed herself of her past.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_28_DESC.text: Cindy encounters many dangers on the road, but nothing can stop her and her secret heavy firearm hidden in her parasol! The determined Cindy finally finds Jarvis, with whom she returns to her family mansion. Content that that Jarvis has returned by her side, Cindy resumes her facade of a quiet and well-behaved lady to attend balls and social gatherings once more. Cindy's parents, however, don't seem too happy - how can they ever accept a mere cat butler into the family?

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_29_DESC.text: A few months after the onset of Malsook and the tiger’s daily mountainside battle, Malsook finds herself broke with the expenses of her bullets. Malsook, after some deliberation, breaks away from her repertoire to cook up her most delicious tteok, which she presents before the tiger, telling him that today is the last day she can afford to “shoot” him. The tiger only chuckles, telling her that he will soon pay her back for all the delicious tteok she has fed him. After his departure, Malsook finds a pile of valuable mountain insam roots in the place he had been standing. Within a few years, Malsook begins a proper tteok business with the money she has earned from selling the insam roots. While she finds her business bustling, she finds it rather odd that most of her customers do not come expecting a bite of her delicious dishes, but ask after her tteok bullets, rumored to be very effective against mountain beasts.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_30_DESC.text: Silver continues to work hard as the town’s unofficial hero—until he comes to witness a suspicious transaction between Captain and Popo the Traveling Merchant. His hero senses tingling, Silver visits the Gatcha Rangers’ headquarters. He finds his friends being attacked and kidnapped by a gigantic Deerdog, which flees after being defeated by Silver’s cannon. Silver informs the Gatcha Rangers that Captain is behind their kidnapping. The shocked heroes swear revenge on their former captain and ask Silver for help in seeking vengeance. Silver, overjoyed that he can finally play “heroes and villains” with his friends, accepts the request and becomes the town’s newest hero: “Gatcha Ranger Silver.”

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_31_DESC.text: Matahari, however, is soon captured by the Cardinal’s Order of Black Roses. It is revealed that Matahari deceptively exploited Aramis’s status and Muskeeter badge to extract confidential information of the kingdom, divulging the secrets to the neighboring country of Valencia. In order to save her sister from certain death as well as her own honor and innocence, Aramis begs the Cardinal to use her however as he sees fit. The Cardinal orders Aramis to capture Prince Cain, who is reported to have made a pact with a devil. Aramis secretly leaves Trista on her new mission, intent on saving herself and her sister so that they may return to the innocent days of their childhood which seem far behind them.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_32_DESC.text: Inside the store, Jeomrye discovers a pair of fire-breathing bass and electric guitars. The moment she holds the bass in her hand, she realizes that some of the magic that she shared with Cano had piled up in her soul to harden into ashy lumps of forgotten dreams. Surrounded by not only the roar of drums and vacuum tubes but also the beating of her own heart, Jeomrye lets her fingers dance over the too-familiar strings. The guitar breathes fire, and magic - in all senses of the word - flows out of her heart and over the guitar, finally bursting into long-awaited flames. Magic, sharpened into acute arrows, erupt and puncture. The heat settles at last, and all lies quiet in the instrument shop. At its center stands one musician - no longer 'Miyu,' but fully awoken as 'Ludwig Metalbach.'

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_33_DESC.text: The young new chieftain's ability of controlling insects gradually spreads to all members of the Coatl tribe, and they soon found a new village safe from the threats of the jungle. Luca, remembering his initial vow, attempts to lead his people out back into the open, but the voice in his head prophesies that he must stop those who seek the heart of the Volcano. Luca tries to defy the voice, but he is led by unknown forces to order the tribespeople to head deeper into the jungle. There, the tribe discovers a cavernous opening leading inside the Volcano. They step in, following Luca's command - and disappear in flashes of red light that seem almost welcoming.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_33_NAME.text: Luca the Voice of the Volcano

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_34_DESC.text: The strangers, who reveal themselves as scientists of Rapture Science, explain that they are searching for a commander of a new tank brigade designed with magic engineering technology. Svenja's excellent knowledge of armored tactics easily convinces the scientists of her eligibility, and she is released in a matter of minutes. Vowing to restore her glory, Svenja returns to the frontlines - only to be attacked by Miel as soon as she enters the city. Miel's high-energy EMP arrows completely incapacitate the magic engineering technology of the tanks. Svenja, furious that Miel always manages to stand in her way, places a bounty on the other soldier's head. To complete her misfortune, her entire brigade is annihilated with the arrival of the Hero of Hasla, and Svenja barely escapes with only her own tank and crew. At the end of a brief civil war, Svenja discovers that she has once again become a wanted war criminal: a hefty bounty offered for her head, instead of Miel's.

TEXT_CHA_HU_6_36_DESC.text: After the nightmare of the bombing, Tess takes to running out into the streets day and night, delivering speeches against the corruption of the Neth Empire's military and aristocracy. Despite Tess's unresolved grief and anger, the people of Edenberg remain indifferent to the words of a scruffy orphan of the Junkyard, themselves distressed by their own troubles. Tess ponders over ways to catch the attention of the public. She soon discovers a means of communication that can utilize her vocal strengths: rap! Tess works on turning her orations into rap lyrics. Her clear enunciation, quickfire speech, and unrelenting discipline slowly turn the girl into a queen of the streets over many rap battles and performances. Over time she gathers a big fanbase, who appreciates not only Tess's flow and way of words, but also the profound political messages in her lyrics. Her followers grow in number until they form a single group that calls themselves Tess's 'XO Crew.' Even after becoming famous, Tess takes to the streets every day to battle injustice - knowing in her heart that her Scrappy Gang friends, wherever they may be, are fighting alongside her.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_BEARS_4_BERON_DESC.text: With the falling of autumn leaves begins the salmon run, the spawning season for salmon, in the upper reaches of the river near the southeastern borders of Nosgard. Not only is the salmon that migrate back to Nosgard abundant enough to feed all the hungry bears of the borderlands, but they are also full of selenium and other nutrients accumulated while traveling through the 'mystical seas'. The auspicious magic of the sea, coupled with copious amounts of vitamins and antioxidants in salmon, temporarily endows bears with unusually high intelligence. Beron is one such bear who, while devouring fish after fish, becomes fully aware of his own self-consciousness.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_BEARS_5_BERON_DESC.text: Considered a runt among his kind, Beron obsesses over his newfound yet temporary intelligence - to the point that he refuses to return to his old, dull life of gorging himself on salmon for a short season, then spending the rest of the year in stupidity after the effects of the fish diminish. Beron instead conducts research on ways to maintain his acquired intelligence, even stealing the equipment of humans who visit the rivers to fish for salmon. Years pass in a repetitive cycle of concentrating on his research during the salmon runs then returning to his wild state for the remainder of the year... until Beron finally succeeds in creating a machine that extracts and concentrates the magical energy of the mystical seas and selenium of the Nosgardian salmon.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_BEARS_6_BERON_DESC.text: Beron quickly discovers that maintaining his intelligence comes at a cost: enormous amounts of the freshest salmon are required to concoct the medicine that keeps his thoughts from slipping away. Beron, using the patent money from his inventions, founds an annual salmon fishing contest to draw in anglers from all throughout the continent. The competition allows the bear to buy heaps of salmon at ridiculously low prices from fishers who are only too content to throw away their catch for the prize money. While Beron is satisfied with his clever scheme, the other bears are not. Having been forced to reduce their diet due to the new scarcity of salmon, the raging bears gather under the leadership of 'Bera,' who challenges Beron to a bearsome duel. The two bears become sworn enemies after a fierce battle that yields no victor, and it is said that they fight a bloody battle every year on the banks of the Nosgard River.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_COUPLE_4_SCHILD_DESC.text: Beyond the Pass of the Frost Wolf, where even the wind freezes over and no one dares to tread, stand high and mighty the 'Impassable Peaks': known by all in Hasla, seen by few, crossed by none. In the heart of these mountains, at the base of an immense crater that has never seen sunlight, beings ancient and mysterious awaken after eons of deep slumber. As rocks have crumbled down to grains of sand, the one who calls herself 'Schild' has been left only with her own name and her imperfect 'eyes.'

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_COUPLE_5_SCHILD_DESC.text: With only the vaguest of memories veiling her mind, Schild wanders in the dark until she comes across 'Pius,' another one of her kind. They realize not much more than the fact that they knew each other from a long time ago. There is not much more they can do than simply walk on, guiding themselves along the walls of the cave. How much time has passed? Unbeknownst to them, they reach the end of the world, beyond the  dark and misty mountains. At that moment, a glaring ray of light swallows them. In the midst of blinding agony, Schild sees six other figures other than herself and Pius - before each of the eight ancient beings are flung to a different corner of the continent by a mysterious power.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_COUPLE_6_SCHILD_DESC.text: Schild opens her eyes... and discovers herself surrounded by tiny fairies, who hastily flee before the piercing gaze of the ancient being's imperfect 'eyes.' Schild grabs the fairy with the most vibrant wings and inquires about their race. The fairy whimpers that he is 'Oberon,' mayor and leader of the fairy folk, and that if Schild does not let him go at once, his daughter will return soon and avenge his shame. Schild observes Oberon's tears and feels, to her surprise, sadistic glee flooding her heart. She smiles and drags her hostage to the fairy town hall. After declaring the town hall as her new headquarters, Schild decides to use the fairies' divine tree to make weapons while she waits for Oberon's daughter. Who knows? Perhaps the young fairy will remind Schild of her true nature.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_FOURWEEK_4_LASIRENE_.text: Legend has it that ‘monsters that devour the light’ lurk in the deepest waters of the magical sea. In reality, these monsters are criminal mermaids banished by the ‘Elder Sister of the Sea,’ now living together after forming a small town. Lasirenne is one such mermaid, exiled from her hometown for petty theft. She vows vengeance against the ‘Elder Sister,’ but does nothing but waste time due to lack of energy and effort. One day, Lasirenne swims too close to a sea trench, where an anonymous being suddenly pounces on her.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_FOURWEEK_5_LASIRENE_.text: When she comes to her senses, Lasirenne realizes that she has gained the gift of freely roaming the darkest waters of the sea and commanding the deep-sea fish. At first, she uses her newfound abilities for theft and other petty crimes in the town of criminals. As times passes, however, she becomes bolder and comes to rule the streets with her gang of deep-sea creatures. No one dares to oppose her, and Lasirenne smirks to herself, elated at the thought that she too has become a ‘big deal’ like the ‘Elder Sister.’

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_FOURWEEK_6_LASIRENE_.text: One day, Lasirenne finds that she cannot move her hands and tail. Feeling her ego disappearing from her consciousness, she attempts to stop the dark powers coursing through her veins—only for the darkness that had been haunting her to finally claim her soul. How much time has passed? Now having become the “Monster Who Devours Light,” Lasirenne no longer knows. However, when she hears the news that the “Elder Sister” has lost her fins and tail to become a lousy human being, her encumbered soul raises its head. Desiring to see the Elder Sister’s fall with her own eyes—now, she tells herself, the mermaid is nothing but a laughingstock, like she herself was before–Lasirenne summons the darkness around her and departs the dark waters in search of her old nemesis.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_GOGI_4_DELRIEN_DESC.text: Long ago, fairies were respectable citizens of Hasla. But when the Beast King of Roman terrorized their kingdom and forced them into hiding to the Peaks of Glory, the grandeur of the fairy folk was no more. Out of sight, fairies soon faded out of people's memories and came to be considered fantastical creatures found only in "fairy" tales. The heir of the Fairy Kingdom, Delrien, could not stand her people being treated in this dishonorable manner - and decides to gather like-minded fairies and lead a revolution. For the honor of her people - and their freedom!

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_GOGI_5_DELRIEN_DESC.text: Delrien leads her fellow fairies to seize control of the castle. Honey drips down, thicker than blood, and cold apple pies roll on the floor on this baleful day. Delrien succeeds in banishing her father and succeeding the throne, and the new queen of the fairy folk declares that she will fight for the freedom of her people. However, the citizens of the fairy kingdom, having witnessed the princess's cruelty to her own father, only hide in their homes and refuse to listen to Delrien. The enraged princess seethes in anger, until only the brave Fairy Knight Almael offers her loyalty. The two fairies leave the Peaks of Glory to the human world below.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_GOGI_6_DELRIEN_DESC.text: Delrien arrives in the capital of Roman. She bellows to the crowd gathered before her to bring her the Beast King -at once-, but the humans only emit high-pitched screams and do not listen to her commands. Just as her anger reaches boiling point, a passing hunter properly recognizes Delrien and Almael as fairy folk. The hunter informs the two fairies that the Beast King has left the capital in order to subdue a revived dragon, and that she will gladly take them to the Beast King as she was on her way to help him. Delrien happily accepts the offer. It won't be long before the Beast King is defeated for good and the fairy folk reclaims their former glory!

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_OT_4_03_DESC.text: Age 18, female. A merchant stocking the shelves of her parents' shop in the port town Rippletide located in the Coastlands.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_OT_5_03_DESC.text: She often found herself gazing out at sea, longing for something more.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_OT_6_03_DESC.text: 「What lies beyond the horizon?」 Then, one day, an unfamiliar vessel weighed anchor at her docks.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_TNT_4_ORGA_DESC.text: Hidden amidst the frozen sea to the northeast of Nosgard, impenetrable by any human, there lies the legendary Penguin Kingdom. Although Olga is the daughter of Orca, the thirty-second Queen of Penguin Kingdom, and thus a potential candidate for the throne, her small stature and dull mind provoke ridicule from the rest of her family. One day, Olga discovers a strange mechanical device on the ice next to a broken glacier: an artifact of Steamer technology, indistinguishably old yet mysteriously still active. Olga stares at the machine, uncertain what to do with it. As she continues gazing, she finds her usually foggy mind clearing, and before she knows what she is doing, Olga's mind wholly embraces the sharp, repetitive signals emitting from the device...

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_TNT_5_ORGA_DESC.text: The Steamer artifact stops functioning a short time later, and Olga, guided by a newfound instinct, sets off collecting other pieces of Steamer machinery scattered throughout the tundra. The pieces fit perfectly together, creating a machine that can control the minds of animals of the tundra. It is only at sunset that Olga - now made a new penguin, revealing no trace of her former incompetency but instead draped in a mysterious, powerful aura - returns to the kingdom. When the entranced Queen Orca names Olga her sole successor that very night, no penguin can think to oppose the decision. The new heir apparent starts traveling throughout the tundra upon a stupefied bear, hypnotizing all who come across her path. After gaining mental control over every last penguin in the kingdom, Olga begins the last step of her plan: the construction of a military factory, and the rising of a cyborg penguin army.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_TNT_6_ORGA_DESC.text: Just before Olga succeeds in building a Steamer army strong enough to threaten not only the tundra, but all of Hasla, the tremors of an earthquake originated from Elder Edda hit Penguin Kingdom. The ice on which the kingdom rests cracks under the pressure, and tumultuous waves engulf the penguins through the cracks. Queen Orca, her penguin subjects, and Steamers sink into the frigid waters below, and after the earthquake stills, only a few penguins remain by Olga's side. Following a voice inside her head, Olga leads the surviving penguins to the sea and collects the remaining Steamer devices. Just then, an alien creature pops up from the waters and onto the ice. After observing the creature's mighty stomps breaking the ice and causing the ground to shake, Olga mistakenly comes to identify it as the cause of her kingdom's destruction. An uncontrollable rage consumes her, and Olga commands her penguins to chase after the creature: the bane of her people and undoer of her mighty plans.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_YS8_4_HUMMEL_DESC.text: A Transporter full of mysteries and extreme pride in his career. Once accepting a request from a client, Hummel will refuse to rest until he finds it perfectly carried out.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_YS8_5_HUMMEL_DESC.text: Hummel boards the Lombardia for his newest 'job.' After being shipwrecked on the Isle of Seiren, he meets Adol and company in their exploration of the island. Hummel ignores them in the beginning, but joins them after realizing that their objectives are the one and the same.

TEXT_CHA_HU_LIMITED_YS8_6_HUMMEL_DESC.text: Hummel thanks Adol and company after he finishes his 'job' at the northern regions of the Isle of Seiren. Declaring that a safe return home is also a part of his 'job,' he wholeheartedly joins Castaway Village in their mission to escape the island. During their explorations, however, the company is teleported by a mysterious Energy Crystal to the land of Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_PA_1_11_DESC.text: A scholar who lives in the forest to collect plant samples more easily. He has a habit of talking to himself, the villagers say.

TEXT_CHA_PA_1_12_DESC.text: This merchant comes from a long line of skilled and clever traders who have lived in the Desert for generations. It's a pity that every generation of the family suffered from a very poor sense of direction, which is not the best quality to have when your career requires traveling long distances.

TEXT_CHA_PA_1_13_DESC.text: If there's a castle wall to fix, the Castle Repairman is your man! Widely admired for his skills, he emits an aura of a proper artisan when he holds up his hammer.

TEXT_CHA_PA_1_14_DESC.text: The latest android released to the public, with brand-new functions. The android oversees security at Road Industry and will automatically tackle and hold down anyone it deems an intruder. Unlike its prototype, it does not cause serious malfunctions such as self-destruction... except it will occasionally recognize all objects within a 100-meter radius as 'the enemy.'

TEXT_CHA_PA_1_15_DESC.text: Byuljooboo has come to the Taebaek Mountains in search of a hare's liver. He saw Dongsamo's back and mistook him for a hare and chased him, but was unable to catch up. He's still chasing after him, though.

TEXT_CHA_PA_2_15_DESC.text: A nameless knight who silently carries out the requests of his village while others clamor for fame and renown.

TEXT_CHA_PA_2_16_DESC.text: A renowned plasterer who is famous for the quality of his bricks. He travels to the Temple of Illusions with dreams of studying the renowned yet lost techniques of Ancient Desert architecture. Upon coming face-to-face with the Temple, Fukhu is immediately stricken by its beauty and enters in wonder.

TEXT_CHA_PA_2_17_DESC.text: A specialist of snow removal specially stationed by the Neth Army for a "top-secret mission." Ever since he experienced a terrible blizzard of the northern lands, however, he becomes hysterical whenever the clouds start to darken.

TEXT_CHA_PA_2_18_DESC.text: A test subject experimented upon by scientists before they reconstructed a soulless body from the Kingdom of Trista. As no safety measures were taken into consideration in the process, the unstable subject became more and more violent as the experiment progressed. It was eventually locked up in an abandoned lab somewhere in Rapture Science.

TEXT_CHA_PA_2_19_DESC.text: The top chef of the palace that can make all sorts of delicacies. Even if the same ingredients are used, those dishes show hallucinations. Scorched rice soup is his top dish!

TEXT_CHA_PA_3_17_DESC.text: Nothing is known about this mysterious protector of the Ents - save that he is enraged at a certain Elf for daring to eat Ent bark. How barbaric!

TEXT_CHA_PA_3_18_DESC.text: A woman who volunteered for an experiment for eternal youth in order to live forever with her lover. Unfortunately, the experiment fails - but not without yielding the partial success of aging immortality. Immediately after the experiment, the undying test subject is brainwashed and turned into a living sample for researchers to study.

TEXT_CHA_PA_3_19_DESC.text: It is the Snow Mountain Climber's ambition to climb the snowy peaks of Nosgard, infamous as they are among mountaineers. She hasn't succeeded in conquering a single peak as of yet, but she'll get there someday!

TEXT_CHA_PA_3_20_DESC.text: A security guard who works the graveyard shift at Road Industry. She's afraid of the dark, but she needed the extra money.

TEXT_CHA_PA_3_21_DESC.text: A gatekeeper that guards the entrance of the palace. He became a gatekeeper in order to see the Five Tiger Generals he admires so much from up close. He is bright by nature, but maintains a stern expression at the job.

TEXT_CHA_PA_3_FUGUROID_DESC.text: An experimental android devised by Fergus in hopes of inventing an automated domestic robot. It runs on the power of Old Weapons and can even activate some of their skills. Fergusroid is still in its initial stages of development, however, and can't really be used for anything practical. ..... is what Fergus told you, but scrawled on the back of its head, you find the words 'Ent Robot Skill Test, No. 32.'

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_22_DESC.text: The son of a house of warriors on the outskirts of the Kingdom of Chen. Although his family wishes for Mengqi to become a scholar and thus obtain fame and wealth more easily, Mengqi only wishes to become a warrior like his father. A strained relationship with his father quickly escalates to an outburst, which leads to Mengqi being kicked out of his home. Mengqi leaves with his beloved stallion 'Fierce Dragon' to seek the path of the warrior.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_23_DESC.text: A run-of-the-mill mercenary of Nosgard. One day, Heim happens to hear a rumor of great treasure hidden deep in the forbidden Sacred Ground of Nosgard. Ignoring the fact that no one is allowed to tread into the sanctuary, Heim persuades some of his friends to follow him on what should be his most lucrative adventure.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_24_DESC.text: A magical girl idol produced to compete against Cano. Despite her slogan "Magical Girl with Magical Powers that Hunts Down Villains," some say she pushes around the special effects team to make her look like an actual magical girl.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_25_DESC.text: On the way to the capital of Grancia to receive his knighthood training, Caeneus stumbles upon a group of bandits. At the moment of despair, a figure of light and mercy arrives to save the day: Lady Victoria of the Cobalt Knights. Caeneus is instantly moved by the graceful knight and vows to enter tha ranks of the Cobalt Knights at all costs.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_26_DESC.text: Thor's elder brother and a member of the Nosgardian royal family. While Odin does retain every right to the throne as Thor's brother and regards his position to the kingdom with kingly love and responsibility, he often clashes with Thor due to their opposing political values and views on ruling the kingdom.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_28_DESC.text: A girl who grew up in the Junkyard of Neth Empire and has, like all children who grow up there, joined 'the Scrappy Gang.' After fixing a discarded TV and seeing a broadcast of Colosseum battles, Fireaxe comes to revere the sweaty, glorious world of gladiators.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_29_DESC.text: The reason I gave up my place as one of the Five Tiger Generals? Well, I 'spose I hafta tell you about that day those damned monsters came attacking our small town. It may be forty years ago, but I sure do remember it clear as crystal. It was one of those summer days when the sun is a-shinin' and you can feel the heat rising from the earth, and you think to yourself well this summer is going to be mighty hot indeed! And I, a green beansprout I was back then, I was preparing for the autumn harvest with the village elders. It was then those monsters came trampling over our hard work, two Goblins and three Ents, and was I surprised to see them just charging forth like bulls before red! But I told myself, well Shuwen if you were born a man then you hafta act like one before you're dead and regretting you never did, so I summoned up all the courage I had and faced them straight. Turns out my fist was a force to be reckoned with - those monsters fell to the ground before they could step on another potato! 'This young'un was born strong,' was what the village elders said, and I reckon this strength comes from my mama's side of the family. After this day I began to train under ol' 'Drunken Fist,' who they say was quite the somethin' in the old days of war (though I thought he was just an old drunkard before I started training). Anyway, I couldn't concentrate on my training since rumors spread of my fight with those two Goblins and three Ents, and our quiet town was bumblin' with people who thought they could fight - I couldn't take one step out of my hut without someone challenging me to a duel! One of them was the sole descendant of a famous clan - we became good friends after this and that happened but this is a story for another time. But those challengers were more bark than bite and everyone fell to one punch of my fist - I was a little sorry because they had traveled all this way to our village and they didn't stay long after they lost, even when everyone offered a good hot meal that wouldn't have gone to waste, no sir. I wonder what they were doing now, now that I think of it, the saints bless them wherever they are. And then a few years passed and

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_30_DESC.text: Those who value their strength flock to the Arena of Roman in the hopes of being crowned the Gladiator Champion. With the onset of a new season, a man donning a lion mask comes towering over the other applicants. Many belittle the contrast he depicts, standing bare-handed and lightly armed among other monstrous warriors heavily equipped—only to watch on in amazement when he easily defeats his competitors and passes the preliminary rounds. ‘Lion Mask,’ as he comes to be known, attracts many new fans with his extraordinary performance of equal parts agility, experience, and brute strength: all executed with a sensational streak never seen before by even the experts on the long tradition of Roman gladiators. Envious of Lion Mask’s newfound popularity, many gladiators challenge him. Yet all fall before the beast’s visage.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_31_DESC.text: An apprentice inquisitor of the Order of the Goddess. Taken in by the Order after being orphaned at an early age, Cecilia has grown up a devout follower of the Goddess. She is famous for her utter devotion to any command from the Order as well as her merciless punishments. However, when a new faction emerges from within the Order and quickly dominates the Holy City of Elandia with their different doctrines, Cecilia's faith too begins to falter.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_32_DESC.text: As an inquisitor of the Order of the Goddess one hundred years ago, Luci was sworn to the holy task of hunting down the nefarious race of Devils who had sold their souls to Demons. She captured and sent more Devils to the executioner than anyone else in the Order, a feat by which she became known as ‘the Guardian of Light.’ One day, Luci is attacked and possessed by a lone Devran, who had been wandering in search of a host. The inquisitor successfully resists the creature with her divine powers of light, but she could not prevent her physical body from transforming into that of a Devil.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_33_DESC.text: Otis may have been born as the eldest son of a noble house of Trista, but neither prestige nor wealth guaranteed as his birthright can truly restrain his rebellious nature. When he is finally cut off by his family for his reckless feats, Otis settles in the slums of the borderlands, threatening funds from the nearby merchant guild under the excuse of a 'protection fee.' After some time, Otis receives a formal request from the same guild to be true to his word: apparently, the merchants' stores have recently been terrorized by foreign thugs. Otis easily rounds up the villains and returns home, not realizing that one of those 'foreign thugs' was the son of an infamous gang leader.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_35_DESC.text: An ancient spirit found wandering near the Sanctuary of the Elder Edda. He can remember neither who he is nor what regrets he still has in the world to be haunting it. He only knows that he cherishes his tombstone, of which time has eroded the inscription - all except for the words 'Snorri,' his name... Or at least, cherishes enough as a weapon to pummel the ice spirits he meets while meandering aimlessly through the tundra.

TEXT_CHA_PA_4_36_DESC.text: The forest guarded by the Deer Spirit Neulsolgil is always crowded with visiting spirits. Whenever Neulsolgill starts beating out a rhythm with her hammer, the animals of the woods respond with their own music, and the other spirits revel in the joyful harmony, forgetting - for a short moment - the troubles of the outside world. The Forest of Spirits is hence a place of jubilation and bliss, hidden away from unfriendly eyes through Neulsolgil's powers. Yet a darkness grows outside the woods, a darkness that they cannot avoid forever...

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_22_DESC.text: In the foggy depths of the mountains Mengqi trains alone, never looking back. When he finally steps forth to take the performance exams of Chen, his prowess and skill with his spear makes him an instant favorite with the generals of Chen. Yet Mengqi regards his success as short-reached, and leaves for the frontlines of the battlefield to perform great feats his father may acknowledge.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_23_DESC.text: Heim and company barely defeat the Guardian of the Sacred Ground before entering the forbidden sanctuary. They soon realize that the sanctuary is guarding something under its seal, but before they can escape they fall under a cursed sleep. Doomed to become the new Guardians of the Sacred Ground, they slumber...

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_24_DESC.text: She would always have a chat with villains ahead of the match, during which they would surrender. This makes fans raving over Yuna calling her an "Icon of Peace," however, those who had "the chat" with her could not particularly agree with that nickname.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_25_DESC.text: True to his word, Caeneus works hard to overcome the difficult training and exams required to enter the Cobalt Knights, led under Victoria's flag. He volunteers for the position of flag bearer to stand at the vanguard and to aid Victoria at a closer distance. Over the years, Caeneus shows his worth at the front of the troops and is promoted to Vice Captain of the Cobalt Knights. However, his days of fulfillment come to a sudden end when Victoria receives Alexander's summoning and leaves for 'greater tasks.'

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_26_DESC.text: Odin proposes to his younger brother that they must unite the kingdom to a single, central power, with the royal line maintaining a firm hand over their immense territory. Yet Thor disagrees, claiming that such centralization is not only realistically impossible, but also inconsistent with his own values on ruling the kingdom.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_28_DESC.text: Fireaxe finally manages to arrive at Roman, intent on becoming a gladiator. Yet her skinny physique and meager strength do not help her in the ruthless arena, and Fireaxe loses battle after battle. The one fateful day, Fireaxe happens to see an interview of Achilles, the legendary gladiator of Roman.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_29_DESC.text: I thought that I had done some good with my training under ol' 'Drunken Fist,' and it seemed my fist was ready to do something in the world. I asked myself, what can I do for my country? because I may not be much more than a country bumpkin but even a country bumpkin can fight for his king if he puts his mind to it! It was then that Lil' Buddy told us a rumor he had heard from the village down yonder. Seemed there had been some scuffling at the borders with the neighboring lands over some problem or other, and it was likely that the fight would blow up into war. Well, what better cause was there for me to use my years of training to do some good? I decided there and then that I would devote myself to the country I was born and raised and loved like my own mama. 'Goodbye,' I said to the people listening to Lil' Buddy's story, 'I reckon I can use my fists for some good there.' I didn't even bother packing and just headed straight for the borderlands, where I found out that Lil' Buddy's rumor had been true all along and war had begun. It was an interesting part of life, because you meet all sorts of people in war, you see. We won some battles and lost some too, but the records I kept still show that I won all the 300 duels I fought by myself. 'The Undefeated Fighter,' my comrades called me, and I gotta admit that made me feel pretty special - not just 'cause of the name but the fact that I could feel my comrades loved me as much as I loved them. Blessed souls, every one of them. So I fought for years and years, protecting the borders of our country, until a man from the Royal Court came looking for me. Wanted me to take me out of war and into the palace for some reason he wouldn't say, and I admit I was curious, but I refused if that meant I had to leave my comrades behind. So you can imagine my surprise when those very comrades came crowding around me and the man from the Royal Court. 'Shuwen, a man's gotta know his true calling when it comes for him.' Wise words from blessed souls. So I followed the man to the Royal Palace, where I shocked to discover that the king himself wanted to make me one of his Five Tiger Generals! Ain't that something! I thought to myself, well, this must be my true calling then, and I said yes, Your Majesty, all grand and important-like. You see, it wasn't just because of fame and honor that I accepted. A grand title means that you can do more things, it opens doors for a man to pursue greatness. And I was confident that I could do great things for my country and its people. But after some time I became a Tiger General, I found that not everyone thinks the same. Was pure tomfoolery, what they were doing at the Palace, and they sure didn't 'preciate a country bumpkin bumping shoulders with them. I went through some things a man shouldn't have to go through, not if he respects his fellow countrymen, but since that's another story I won't talk about it here. Anyway I left, because what's a grand title if you can't do great things with it? It was more disappointing as

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_30_DESC.text: Who is Lion Mask? What illustrious warrior stands behind the disguise? None of the numerous theories surrounding Lion Mask’s identity can place him: is he a new prototype developed by the scientists of Neth Empire? Perhaps a messenger from the mysterious floating islands above? Or perhaps (this is one of the more fanciful theories) he is an Ogre suffering dwarfism. At any rate, Lion Masks claims victory after victory amongst the wild cheer of the crowd, reaching the final round of the Arena. The Arena’s current Champion Achilles and his mysterious challenger Lion Mask face each other—and begin a ruthless battle that lasts for hours. Lion Mask’s light feet easily evade the heavy blow of Achilles’s infamous ‘Thanatos,’ but Achilles’s golden armor also proves resilient to Lion Mask’s punches. At last, the victor emerges: Achilles. Yet many agree that he “got lucky” as Lion Mask forfeited after spraining his lower back.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_31_DESC.text: Under the new faction's lead, a Holy War breaks out in the Holy City of Elandia. Cecilia is also called to battle as a 'fighter nun.' Yet after seeing the chaos and hatred dividing the people who once all worshipped the same Goddess, Cecilia becomes overwhelmed with doubt and dejection. She finds that she cannot wield her hammer in battle, even at the risk of failing her comrades. After the war, the nun is even more horrified to witness many followers of the Goddess being executed for heresy, branded as pagans and dissidents. Cecilia finds her faith completely dissolved before the sight.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_32_DESC.text: During the harsh interrogations by the very comrades with whom she once fought side by side, Luci demonstrates that she still retains full control of her divine powers. Yet despite proof of her innocence, the other inquisitors fail to see her as more than a mere demon with hideous horns and a tail. When she is condemned to burn at the stake, Luci loses all hope. She closes her eyes and waits for death… but moments before the flames engulf her, she is freed by Demona.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_33_DESC.text: Now targeted by dozens of infamous gangsters, Otis finds himself on the run. Otis's displays of daring and strength, however, gain the interest of the gang leader, who - to Otis's surprise - hands over a smuggling route with which he should "prove himself." Otis so ends up pledging a blood bond with the Boss. Now in charge of escorting the Boss's wagons that smuggle in black tea - the most valuable contraband luxury good in the whole desert - Otis must face battle after battle with righteous sheriffs and other greedy gangs. No one is a match for Otis, however, and the legend of the 'invincible outlaw' continues for days, weeks, and years. In the end, Otis wins from other outlaws the respectful epithet of 'Bloody Sunset' - supposedly for the color of the black tea for which he has developed a taste and insists on sipping even in battle.

TEXT_CHA_PA_5_35_DESC.text: One day, Snorri finds himself face-to-face with Wolfgang, who has come to Elder Edda to rebuild it. When the spirit notices the emblem of the Royal Guard on the man's armor, he is flooded with a certain powerful memory of his bygone life: that of a dear friend with whom he used to hunt deer dogs together. In hopes of remembering more, Snorri continues to haunt Wolfgang, who initially considers him a will-o'-the-wisp attempting to lure him away. However, Wolfgang gradually realizes that the spirit means no harm whatsoever and begins to accept the strangely familiar presence. After spending much time around Wolfgang, Snorri finally comes to recall his true identity: the first king of Nosgard.
