TEXT_CHA_WA_4_25_DESC.text: A free-spirited young demon living with her older sister Sfera in a deserted castle on the outskirts of Valencia. While Echidna does try to take heed of her sister's warning and keep to herself, it's so difficult when she is so curious about the outside world! It is obviously not her fault (or so she claims) that she is so often seen by unwitting passerbys who just happen to look in her direction.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_26_DESC.text: A blind man who lives in a small country village in the Eastern Kingdom of Han. Although he tends to idly squander away all his time using his blindness as an excuse, he manages to scrape by thanks to his devoted daughter, Sim Cheong.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_27_DESC.text: The younger sister of Thjalfi, who is rumored to have the fastest legs in all of Nosgard. Fewer people know that it is Roskva, in fact, who is now faster, after years of literally, angrily chasing after her obnoxious brother who made fun of her all the time. One day, Roskva receives an offer from Heim to join the Nosgard mercenary troupe. The innocent Roskva, seeing the offer as an opportunity to finally prove her worth over her brother's, gladly accepts - unaware that she has just sealed her fate...

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_28_DESC.text: It was amidst some unidentified ruins near the Temple of Illusions that Nefer was discovered and taken as a collector's item by a novice Tristan archaeologist. In the chaos and bloodshed that ravaged the kingdom soon after, a single drop of blood falls through Nefer's sarcophagus and death mask. Nefer licks the speck of blood off her shriveled lips and slowly... creaks open the lid of her coffin.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_29_DESC.text: Gwen may be a common follower of the Order of the Goddess, but her dream is an unusually ambitious one: all her life, she has dreamt of awakening the Holy Sword of Elanuma from its resting place in the Grand Cathedral of Elandia and becoming the Holy Chosen Knight. In order to achieve her dream, Gwen decides that she must first enter the Order of the White Lion, protectors of the churches of the Goddess. After years of training, she is finally admitted into the Order of the White Lion. Yet Gwen soon discovers that the knighthood is not at all what she is expected: most Lion Knights are false believers who only pretend their faith in order to gain prestige, and save for a very small number of Maesters, do not perform even the bare minimum of training. The disillusioned Gwen keeps her disappointment to herself, however, and continues to train by herself, relying on her sword and herself if nothing else.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_30_DESC.text: Morgan is proud to say that he was never truly dependent on his bloodline to fulfill his aspirations. Despite being a close relative of Emperor Alexander, he claims that it is through his own capabilities that he has become the illustrious Captain of the Cobalt Knights, known throughout Grancia. Yet his ambitions and royal heritage pave an easy way to corruption: devious sycophants slither to the young prince’s side to whisper flattery and deception into his ears, gradually corrupting his heart to darkness. Intoxicated on the false promise of glory and absolute power, Morgan expels his only loyal Vice Captain and begins scheming the downfall of the Emperor—and his own reign of the Empire.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_31_DESC.text: The Captain of the Southern Guards as well as an experienced knight skilled with both gun and blade. It is said that after Soltar’s corruption and subsequent downfall, Laertes singlehandedly defended the kingdom of Valencia from hungry foreign powers seeking to claim the empty throne of the House of Ferdinand. When the situation of Valencia becomes relatively stable, Laertes leads his soldiers to the borders of the kingdom, aware that he has other vital duties he must attend to.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_32_DESC.text: Ares is said to have been the most outstanding honors student in the history of Roman Republic Military Academy. Thanks to his compatibility with the ‘Red Ring’ given to students at the Military Academy, Ares received better grades than any other student in mock battles. This proved to a double-edged sword, however; the influence of the ring caused him to become argumentative and impatient, eventually leading him to ruthlessly beat down a stranger in an argument. Ares is forced to graduate two years late, but the former Ares, considering the young man’s potential, recruits him as a member of his personal troops, the ‘Golden Galeas of the Battlefield.’

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_33_DESC.text: The daughter of Senator Hades of the Olympian Council. Hoping to succeed the title of her well-respected father one day, Macaria has trained since childhood with members of Hades’s special forces ‘Styx.’ The Styx members take an immense liking to their leader’s daughter and come to regard Macaria as their own niece. They present Macaria with advice and information that proves to be valuable indeed, as the young girl succeeds in passing the exam of the ‘Amethyst Ring’ with flying colors - even before she enters the Military Academy. On the day of Macaria’s school entrance ceremony, dozens of devoted Styx members hide in the auditorium to watch, nobody in the audience noticing their sneaky invasion.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_34_DESC.text: 'Bloody Rose Jack,’ one of Lord Gordian’s most loyal subordinates infamously known as the ‘Fearsome Four,’ is respected and feared by all in Hell Island. As Jack never goes anywhere without being completely clad in her suit of heavy armor, no one knows her secret: she is not an actual Devil, but a strange plant-like creature called a Dryad. Before assuming her current form, Jack had been a native plant that had taken root in the island long before it was dubbed ‘Hell Island’ by its new residents. After years of peaceful isolation in the forest, the plant gains sentience and meets Gordian, receiving from him the name ‘Jack.’ Her curiosity piqued, Jack follows the Devil out of the woods to a completely new life.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_35_DESC.text: An ordinary woodsman living on the outskirts of Nosgard. His mighty stature, seemingly the stuff of legends, belies his timid personality. Villagers tend to exploit his naivety for cheap timber, but Hrolf hardly complains as he sets out every day to climb the harsh, snow-capped mountains. While roaming the dark woods one fateful day, Hrolf staggers in surprise at the sudden 'clang' of weapons resonating from a short distance away. His senses sharpened, the logger nervously follows the sound to discover a man brandishing his battle axe at the numerous poachers who surround him. Hrolf, without a second thought, raises his logging axe and runs forth to help the brave warrior.

TEXT_CHA_WA_4_36_DESC.text: As the only son of a noble house of Neth, Dempsey should have led a happy life. Yet his life turns upside down on his eighth birthday, when malfunctioning androids suddenly invade his birthday party and begin viciously attacking the guests. Among the victims of the bloodshed are Dempsey's parents, and Dempsey freezes in shock as the android drenched in his parents' blood turns to him. Moments before certain death, golden lightning flashes before Dempsey's eyes, and the rogue android collapses into a pile of scrap metal. The young boy passes out to fear and horror, but the image of his savior is seared into his mind: an old man whose bare fists dismantled a killing machine with a single punch.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_22_DESC.text: Izuna does not return to the dojo, instead swearing to herself that she will master her swordsmanship and show the Master her worth. Having departed quite hastily, however, she soon finds herself run out of money and a place to stay. Izuna decides to hunt down wanted criminals for a living, telling herself that such arrangements are temporary.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_23_DESC.text: Freyja, leader of the Einherjar, acknowledges Randgrid's valor and appoints her as the Vanguard Captain. Randgrid leads her troops against the forces of Odin, claiming victory after victory. However, her excessively cruel attitude toward her captives comes to the attention of King Thor, who orders her to immediately stop any unnecessary violence. Randgrid ignores the command, declaring that she must protect the Einherjar tradition and her own honor.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_24_DESC.text: Cassia easily breaks the seal and enters the chamber. She discovers a sole antique sword in the middle of the room, and when she picks it up, the blade starts to tell her of curses, dark hoaxes, powerful magic: the dark magic forbidden to all witches of Pumpkin City. Cassia vaguely tells herself that the sword is a thing of evil and that she must escape at once, but the whispers of the blade prove too seductive. Years afterward, a series of rumors spread throughout Pumpkin City of witches being abducted one by one, and a dark figure gazing from the shadows. The Four Great Witches of Pumpkin City, perceiving the truth behind the rumors, investigate into the matter, and discover that Cassia is the culprit.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_25_DESC.text: One day, a mysterious traveler calling himself 'Elf Mask' comes to offer the two sisters a position in the Minor Tribes' Confederation. Echidna wholeheartedly agrees to the stranger's proposal, as it has been her lifelong dream to travel the world. Needless to say, she is very much disappointed when Sfera declines the offer.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_26_DESC.text: Ever the dutiful daughter, Sim Cheong comes to hear a rumor of the Enlightened Otter's teachings and their mysterious healing powers. She drags her unwilling father out of their home and starts on a journey to recover Sim Hak-Gyu's sight.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_27_DESC.text: Roskva follows the rest of the mercenary to the forbidden sanctuary and helps Heim defeat the Guardian of the Sacred Ground. They soon realize that the Sanctuary is guarding some mysterious power. Before they can investigate what the seals hold, however, all fall under a cursed slumber, their sin having burdened them with the responsibility of becoming the next Guardians.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_28_DESC.text: Nefer crawls through the shadows that have fallen over Trista, recovering most of her strength - but not her memories. Only the faintest mirage of the Ancient Kingdom, her home, lingers like an illusion at the back of her mind. The lands that should have been familiar to her eyes have been greatly changed by the passing centuries. The only link to her forgotten past is the symbol and the engraved words 'Beloved Nefer' on her sarcophagus.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_29_DESC.text: Gwen's indefatigable nature and hard training earn the recognition of the Maesters of the Order of the White Lion, and Gwen is soon made one of the ten Crusader Captains. The young knight becomes elated, knowing that she has gotten one step closer to achieving her lifelong dream of awakening the Holy Sword of Elanuma. But when the Captain of the Order of the White Lion declares that they will stop serving a 'false goddess' and start believing in a being  named 'El Thalnos,' Gwen is shocked to discover that only she protests against the decision. The other knights are indifferent, and especially the senior knights, who had been secretly disapproving of Gwen's quick promotion up the ranks, take ahold of the opportunity to slander her loyalty to the Order. Gwen is demoted and banished to a small church near the borderlands - where she misses the full blow of war and ironically survives the ordeal unscathed.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_30_DESC.text: Morgan maintains a façade of honor and righteousness to other knights of the Order, all the while giving way to various atrocities and exploitations in the shadows of anonymity. Darkness lingering in his heart, the knight forms his own private group of assassins, intent on seizing the perfect moment to strike the Emperor. One day, however, Alexander decrees that Victoria is to replace Morgan as the new Captain of the Cobalt Knights. Morgan sends numerous letters protesting the Emperor’s decision, but Alexander only replies that he is to prove his worth through “his own capabilities,” as he so continuously claimed. Unable to suppress his bitter rage, Morgan challenges Victoria to a duel—only to be miserably defeated, his former skills already wasted away by years of blind arrogance.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_31_DESC.text: After decades of protecting the borders from pillagers and other criminals, Laertes comes to realize that others now deem him the true king of Valencia. The old knight dismisses the people’s praises, protesting that he is merely a soldier of the kingdom and not its king, but such humility only serves to increase the people’s love and respect for him. The nobles of Valencia also place their utmost trust in the knight, seeking Laertes’s guidance whenever they decide upon important matters of the state.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_32_DESC.text: It is not long before Ares inherits the name and position of his predecessor and becomes a senator of Olympus. He scores countless victories inside and outside the borders, and the Olympian Council awards him and the Golden Galeas stronger rings for their accomplishments. However, as the soldiers draw on the power of the ring, they become more and more brutal, while Ares’s obsession with absolute strength heightens. He is eventually led to invade the Peaks of Glory and hunt down ancient species, a forbidden act. The Beast King, unable to take Ares’s atrocities any longer, wages a battle with Ares and takes away his ring.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_33_DESC.text: Macaria graduates from the Military Academy with excellent grades and naturally joins her father’s elite forces. The few voices of dissatisfaction claiming the young soldier’s prestige was bought at her father’s expense fade away as Macaria proves her worth again and again in subsequent missions. While investigating the Tower of Manacar, Macaria and other Styx members are attacked by the ‘Hermit Queen,’ recently roused from her dreamless slumber. To save his daughter and soldiers’ corrupted souls from being devoured by the Hermit Queen, Hades climbs the Peaks of Glory and offers up a sacrificial prayer to his ancestor spirits. Guided by a prophecy from an ancestor, he succeeds in driving away the Hermit Queen’s evil energy by infusing his ring with the light of his soul. Only Macaria, however, fails to wake up; her wound lies too close to her soul, which has begun to fester. Hades and the soldiers of Styx vow revenge and begin their hunt of the Hermit Queen.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_34_DESC.text: As with all things, the long war comes to an end. Jack, having suffered from undesired fame as Gordian’s notorious and equally mysterious soldier, promptly retires from her position. She opens a florist with her early retirement pay, unaware that other Devils still have not forgotten her former reputation as one of the Fearsome Four. No one visits Jack’s new flower shop, and the Dryad is forced to close her business amid piles of debt. After realizing what has transpired, Jack hides her identity to work part-time as a cashier at D-Mart, the local supermarket. The small salary is insufficient to cover her living expenses, however, and Jack is forced to face a difficult decision. In the end, she hesitantly decides to sell off the suit of armor she had received from Gordian. Jack changes her form to resemble that of other Devils and sadly parts with her one treasured item, full of memories.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_35_DESC.text: With the poachers lying groaning at their feet, Hrolf and Wolfgang finally exchange a friendly greeting. It is not long before Wolfgang takes a liking to the amiable woodsman, and with Wolfgang's letter of recommendation, Hrolf enlists in the Royal Guard of Nosgard. Hrolf's natural strength and keen eye - both trained through years of handling high-quality timber - help significantly lower the crime rate in the capital. His contributions soon catch the eye of King Thor, who grants the logger the prestigious title of 'Huscarl': an honor granted to only the most valiant warriors in all Nosgard. Hrolf does not shy away from his newfound glory. Gone is the timid man from the distant woods of the wintry kingdom. Instead an elite warrior of Nosgard, full of all the pride and might any proper Nosgardian warrior should possess, emerges forth.

TEXT_CHA_WA_5_36_DESC.text: The tragic day that robbed Dempsey of everything is too easily forgotten by the world at large, and it is never revealed that the android attack was in fact a coordinated sabotage of 'Road Industry.' Dempsey, however, never forgets his despair of not having the strength to save the people he loved. Over the years, he diligently trains himself, until his fists can crush even steel. Now confident of his strength, he recklessly makes his way to an underground fighting ring to gain more experience. Opponents armed with guns and other lethal weapons quickly fall under the fists of the new champion, whose newfound fame opens paths to even more dangerous and unrestricted matches, including an illegal one against anti-personnel army androids. Can this be his chance at redemption, at overcoming his deep-rooted trauma? Dempsey enters the round with feigned bravado - only to suffer not only massive defeat, but also the loss of his left arm.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_22_DESC.text: With every fugitive she turns in, Izuna finds herself not only richer - but also more famous and experienced for her accomplishments. Even when she attempts to return home a newly made celebrity, she finds herself overrun with requests to capture the next criminal or monster. Izuna finally admits that the life of a free and famous bounty hunter may be her true calling, and, instead of the road back home, starts on a journey to hunt down her fortune.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_23_DESC.text: All in the wintry lands of Nosgard came to know Randgrid as the 'Fear of the Einherjar.' Yet when Freyja succumbs to King Thor's shocking ultimatum and goes into exile, the Einherjar fall into frenzy. The enraged Randgrid leaves to find Odin. She vows to throw Thor out of his throne - and restore their tradition and glory as they are meant to be...

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_24_DESC.text: It is revealed that Cassia, consumed by her desire to use the magic she had learned, had obeyed the sword's whispered commands to sacrifice human beings for magical experiments. Cassia flees from Pumpkin City under the attack of the Four Great Witches, and the evil blade is broken in the process. Only Cassia knew, therefore, that Plaga - the malevolent spirit of the blade - had already consumed and were inhabiting her soul. Cassia and Plaga, now one and whole, start their long journey to find a stronger vessel and finally destroy the Four Great Witches once and for all.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_25_DESC.text: The sulky Echidna attempts to 'persuade' Sfera by threatening to release her snakes in the nearby village. Sfera, worried that they will venture out of the castle only to return disheartened and betrayed, attempts to explain her reasons for declining. Echidna refuses to listen, however - her heart is set on a new life in a new world.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_26_DESC.text: Surprise, surprise - in truth, Sim Hak-Gyu isn't blind at all! He had started to lie about his sight in order to spend his days in idle indulgence, continuing only out of fear of Sim Cheong's reaction. Now years have gone by with him posing as a blind man, and surely Sim Hak-Gyu cannot stop his lies now! Yet all this tripping and falling is growing old, and so is the subtle guilt that burdens his heart. Who knows, it may be time to finally tell his daughter the truth. Not today, however.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_27_DESC.text: Sensing a rupture in the sanctuary, Roskva wakes up after centuries of cursed slumber - only to witness Vernil being attacked by a mysterious assailant. She runs forth to save Vernil, discovering that she has become as light-footed as to not even leave any footsteps in the snow.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_28_DESC.text: Stories reach Nefer's ears about an archaeologist who seeks the truth of the Lost Ancient Kingdom and strange tribespeople who call her home their own. Dew collects on the withered tips of Nefer's fingers. She turns her head to the west. Her hunt begins.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_29_DESC.text: After the war ends, the Captain of the Order of White Lions is banished for his crimes, and Gwen is restationed to Elandia. She soon finds out that she is the only commanding officer remaining among the surviving thirty knights: most senior knights lost their lives or ranks in the war, while all Lion Maesters mysteriously disappeared after receiving suspicious orders. Gwen thus unexpectedly becomes the Captain of the White Lions, and under her command, the remaining Lion Knights start restoring the dilapidated city. Despite the blatant hatred the civilians show the knights, Gwen - understanding and sympathizing with the civilians' distrust - continues to work in silence. On the day that the restoration of Elandia is declared complete and the Order of the White Lion once more wins the people's love and respect, the slumbering Holy Sword of Elanuma begins to glow. Among the cheers of her new friends and family, Gwen finally draws the Holy Sword, its dazzling restored by one knight's resolution and love for her people.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_30_DESC.text: It is over. He has lost everything: wealth, reputation, honor, years in their making. Whispers of condescension and rage plague him. Morgan, unable to acquiesce to the results, sends one of his assassins to Victoria. The assassin’s attempts are foiled by Victoria’s maid, however, and the entirety of his schemes is revealed by Joan of Arc, Captain of the Steel Knights. The formerly renowned knight barely escapes Grancia. His heart twisting with jealous fury, Morgan vows vengeance on Victoria and the Cobalt Knights: the bane of his life, his past and future, his promised Empire. He gathers what remains of his troops outside the Empire and, like the vulture ever vigilant upon its prey, prepares for the day he will have his revenge.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_31_DESC.text: When the resurrected Soltar and his Army of Souls recommence their devastation of Valencia, Laertes hastily returns to the capital, seeking to recruit volunteers who will fight the Apostle by his side. Despite the people’s belief that the time has come for the old knight to officially ascend to the throne, Laertes only continues the long war against Soltar with grave endurance. Finally, when only the battle at the Fortress of Souls lies before them, a knight in worn black armor appears before Laertes and his soldiers. The stranger’s claim that he is the long-lost descendant of the House of Ferdinand is met with scoffs and suspicious glances—but Laertes, to the shock of others, kneels and swears fealty to the stranger, lauding the return of the true king.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_32_DESC.text: Ares, finally freed from the malicious influence of his ring, realizes what he has done and falls into grief. It is ‘Hades’ and ‘Athena,’ fellow senators of Olympus, who help him from his plight. Hades helps to suppress with the blessing of his ancestors the negative energy of the ring that flows through Ares. Meanwhile, Athena explains the origins and history of the rings. Having learned all there is to know, Ares succeeds in mastering his ring’s true powers as his own, but the guilt over his past that has rooted within him endlessly continues to haunt him.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_33_DESC.text: Days and nights go by in an obscure blur. Macaria, in her comatose state, hears her father’s voice calling her amidst the shadows. Her father tells her that ‘the Hermit Queen’ has already absorbed the magic of too many Rings and become a terrible monster that cannot be subdued by Styx troops alone. Before fading away, the voice of Hades insists that Macaria must gather the Olympian Council together if they wish to prevent further evil – and then disappears into the dark. Macaria struggles to follow her father, but instead wakes up dazed in a sickbed. She soon sees clasped in her hands her father’s weapon, Zagreus, and understands the untold truth: her father has passed into the shadows. The Styx members who had stayed behind to nurse Macaria crowd around her bed in amazement, but they silently step back in respect when they come to the same realization: Macaria has succeeded her father as the next ‘Hades.’

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_34_DESC.text: With no other option left, Jack continues to work diligently at D-Mart – until she receives a summon from Gordian. Shocked and somewhat embarassed by the Devil Lord’s sudden call, Jack searches high and low for her suit of armor that she sold off to pay the bills. All she manages to find, however, is a single piece that goes on her left arm, and Jack timidly goes to meet Gordian feeling underdressed. At the castle, Gordian orders Jack to go fetch a good price for his only remaining property, the “Cow King.” It turns out that Gordian himself had been barely making ends meet after granting ample sums of retirement pay to his former squad of Fearsome Four. To exacerbate Gordian’s and Jack’s desperate situation, the innocent Dryad is deceived by a traveler she meets on the road into trading ‘Cow King’ for three beans and a cheap plant nutrient. Enraged, the Devil Lord throws out the sheepish Jack’s earnings out the window. The next day, to everyone’s consternation, a gigantic creature shadows the sky…

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_35_DESC.text: Through feats of battle both great and small, Hrolf gains the trust of King Thor and his men over the years, earning himself the rank of commander-in-chief of the Royal Guards. While the reputation of the Royal Guards peaks under Hrolf's command, Odin leads the Einherjar to invade the capital under the premise of restoring strength and glory of the ancient Nosgardians. Thor orders Hrolf to defend against the rebels. Unbeknownst to the king, it is not only his own brother who is dissatisfied with his mild rule. Persuaded by Odin's insistent claims, Hrolf intentionally withdraws his troops and lets the enemy occupy crucial strongholds, and the capital soon falls into Odin's hands under the rampage of the Einherjar.

TEXT_CHA_WA_6_36_DESC.text: It is over. His past completely consumes him. He finds solace only in the stupor that strong liquor offers. Dempsey roams the alleyways completely drunk, wandering from bar to bar until he stumbles upon a seemingly sympathetic old man in shabby clothes. He falls asleep in the middle of complaining about his plight, unaware that the old man is actually the former chief scientist of Road Industry, on the run from his crimes. Intrigued by strange coincidence of meeting a surviving victim of his beloved androids, the scientist peers at Dempsey's left stump. The next day, Dempsey wakes up... to a hideous mechanical prosthetic arm attached to his body! He attempts to tear off the machine to no avail; a self-defense program implemented within the mechanical arm prevents him. Dempsey roars with rage and despair, smashing everything in sight. He angrily vows to find the scientist whose demonic curiosity ruined his life not only once, but twice. What remains of Road Industry will be completely annihilated by his fists, his own or otherwise.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_COUPLE_4_PIUS_DESC.text: Beyond the Pass of the Frost Wolf, where even the wind freezes over and no one dares to tread, stand high and mighty the 'Impassable Peaks': known by all in Hasla, seen by few, crossed by none. In the heart of these mountains, at the base of an immense crater that has never seen sunlight, beings ancient and mysterious awaken after eons of deep slumber. As rocks have crumbled down to grains of sand, the one who calls himself 'Pius' has been left only with his own name and his imperfect 'fingers.'

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_COUPLE_5_PIUS_DESC.text: With only the vaguest of memories veiling his mind, Pius wanders in the dark until he comes across 'Schild,' another one of his kind. They realize not much more than the fact that they knew each other from a long time ago. There is not much more they can do than simply walk on, guiding themselves along the walls of the cave. How much time has passed? Unbeknownst to them, they reach the end of the world, beyond the  dark and misty mountains. At that moment, a glaring ray of light swallows them. In the midst of blinding agony, Pius sees six other figures other than himself and Schild - before each of the eight ancient beings are flung to a different corner of the continent by a mysterious power.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_COUPLE_6_PIUS_DESC.text: Pius opens his eyes... and discovers himself on a cot in a school infirmary. The ancient being is nursed back to health by a student who, for some strange reason, emits a familiar aura. Contrary to the friendly student, the teachers of the academy fear and antagonize Pius, and report him to the laboratories of the Neth Empire. Pius uses his 'fingers' to fight back against hostile mercenaries and escape the academy - only to falter before the unknown road before him. He is soon found by the nursing club student from the infirmary, who insist on helping him as they are "both dragons who have lost their true powers." Utterly alone and lonely, Pius accepts the boy's peculiar offer and sets out in search of Schild, his only other companion in all of Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_ER_4_01_DESC.text: The first member and leader of the Eto Rangers, who protect the Novel Worlds. Bakumaru may be pretty clumsy and cause trouble at times, but he still has a strong sense of justice and responsibility as leader of the Eto Rangers. Also, as a rat spirit he freezes in fear when he sees any cat.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_ER_4_11_DESC.text: The eleventh member of the Eto Rangers. A hot-blooded personality that hates losing, and is always at the front lines of combat. Always banters with Monk but deep inside acknowledges and respects him.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_ER_5_01_DESC.text: The first member and leader of the Eto Rangers, who protect the Novel Worlds. Bakumaru may be pretty clumsy and cause trouble at times, but he still has a strong sense of justice and responsibility as leader of the Eto Rangers. Also, as a rat spirit he freezes in fear when he sees any cat.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_ER_5_11_DESC.text: The eleventh member of the Eto Rangers. A hot-blooded personality that hates losing, and is always at the front lines of combat. Always banters with Monk but deep inside acknowledges and respects him.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_ER_6_01_DESC.text: The first member and leader of the Eto Rangers, who protect the Novel Worlds. Bakumaru may be pretty clumsy and cause trouble at times, but he still has a strong sense of justice and responsibility as leader of the Eto Rangers. Also, as a rat spirit he freezes in fear when he sees any cat.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_ER_6_11_DESC.text: The eleventh member of the Eto Rangers. A hot-blooded personality that hates losing, and is always at the front lines of combat. Always banters with Monk but deep inside acknowledges and respects him.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_FOURWEEK_4_MARE_DESC.text: For a long time, ever since the Oracle of Water disappeared, the mermaid Maré has been guarding the waters in place of the slumbering Sacred Being of the Sea. For decades she has fought villains, all coveting the power of the Sacred Being, and has turned rather rowdy and boisterous as a result of countless battles. Many sea creatures, however, still respect and admire her, calling her 'our elder sister.' But when Maré realizes that the sea, despite all her endeavors, continues to decay in the Sacred Being's absence, the mermaid decides to become the Oracle and awaken the Sacred Being herself.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_FOURWEEK_5_MARE_DESC.text: Maré visits the Witch of the Sea to ask how she can become the Oracle of Water. The Witch tells Maré that she must first become a human being through a magic potion - which she will sell the mermaid, at the cost of her beautiful voice. However, Maré's voice has become hoarse beyond reparation due to decades of shouting and roaming the sea. The Witch, tearing up after hearing Maré's voice, offers her the potion for free. Maré succeeds in becoming human by drinking the potion. But even after she loses her mermaid's tail and gains human legs, the emblem of the Oracle of Water - a beautiful blue pearl - does not appear. Maré, no longer able to breathe in water, swims up to the beach.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_FOURWEEK_6_MARE_DESC.text: Has she lost her fins and tail for nothing? When, to make matters worse, she hears from sea creatures that a legendary monster has suddenly come out of its lair in the deep waters, the pressured Maré blindly flees. She aimlessly wanders the nearby pier in despair - when she notices the energy of the Sacred Being of the Sea drifting from an old pirate. Maré hears from the pirate that he carried across a mysterious woman to the Eastern Kingdoms on his ship a few days ago. The Oracle of Water had already returned. Maré, hope rekindling in her heart, returns to her friends in the sea waiting for her.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG3_4_BAIKEN_DESC.text: The Crusades, the war between Gears and humans that lasted one hundred years, cost Baiken not only her family and friends but also her right arm and left eye. Baiken has since then sworn revenge against 'That Man,' who is said to have caused the tragedy with his creations.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG3_5_BAIKEN_DESC.text: Thinking that she may be able to gather more clues about That Man if she pursues Gear-related incidents, Baiken rushes to find the Gear Dizzy. When she discovers that Dizzy cannot offer her any information, she leaves in the middle of battle.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG3_6_BAIKEN_DESC.text: While Baiken has committed herself to her revenge against That Man, she decides to help 'May,' a girl of Japanese descent like herself. After a series of eventful adventures, she returns to her main task of finding That Man. Just as fate would have it, a mysterious portal suddenly teleports her to the world of Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG4_4_02_DESC.text: An officer from a dimension different from Hasla's. Protects the President of the United States, Vernon Colin. Despite this, she can come off as ruthless and indolent. She has a partner named 'Rei', a wolf spirit.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG4_4_03_DESC.text: An assassin from a dimension different from Hasla's. Originally, Zato-1 was an assassin who didn't have much to do with the Assassin's Guild, but as a result of invoking the forbidden arts, he sacrificed his eyesight and gained the power to manipulate shadows at will and to sense the presence of his surroundings. Zato-1, who has since gained powerful abilities, becomes the leader of the Assassin's Guild, but fails in an important operation due to the betrayal of Millia and is captured and kept in the dimension prison.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG4_5_02_DESC.text: Despite the busy atmosphere due to the Gear Maker's visit and preparations for the upcoming World Peace G4 summit, Giovanna still lazes around. Then, when the White House is taken over by 'Happy Chaos,' she finds President Vernon escaping from being held hostage with 'Sol Badguy' protecting him and decides to follow them.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG4_5_03_DESC.text: Not long after his incarceration, he learns of the Second Holy Order Selection Tournament, which allows the participation of criminals. Believing that this is his chance to exact revenge against Millia, he participates in the tournament. However, his mind and body are weakened gradually due to the price of his curse, and his body is eventually taken over by his shadow, 'Eddie.' Eddie's ascendancy does not last long as Zato's body continues to deteriorate. As the body withers and comes to an end, Eddie dies along with it before he can find a new host. However, the Conclave resurrects Zato-1's body through experimentation.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG4_6_02_DESC.text: When the president and Sol Badguy have a dangerous encounter with 'Nagoriyuki,' Giovanna intervenes to stop him. Giovanna works with the wolf spirit Rei to overpower Nagoriyuki. Although she wins the fight against Nagoriyuki, she lets him live and loses in the fight against the Nagoriyuki controlled by Chaos afterwards. After everything is over, Giovanna tries to track down Nagoriyuki on her own, but gets caught up in a mysterious dimensional shift and falls into Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GG4_6_03_DESC.text: The resurrected Zato-1 is a completely different person from before. Zato-1, who lost his emotions and is unable to feel any interest in anything, is confined in a dimension prison. But, after encountering Millia, who infiltrated the prison, he protects her and works to prevent the Conclave's plans. He becomes a direct subordinate of Millia, who has become the director of the Post-War Administration Bureau. Then, while traveling to support the G4 summit involving the Gear Maker, he gets caught up in a mysterious dimensional shift and falls into Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GS_4_01_DESC.text: An adventurer who devotes himself to slaying Goblins out of a deep hatred against them. Goblin Slayer is a skilled fighter who reached Silver Rank through defeating only Goblins. While carrying out his regular raids against Goblins with his party members, Goblin Slayer sees a Goblin Lord and his Goblin horde jump through a magical mirror that leads to another dimension. Determined to let no Goblin escape from his grasp, Goblin Slayer follows his enemies to Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GS_4_07_DESC.text: A Silver Rank adventurer, known as the "the best adventurer on the frontier," Spearman begins his search for Goblin Slayer on a quest from Guild Girl to bring the missing adventurer back. Learning that Goblin Slayer and his party teleported to a world called Hasla to chase after a Goblin Lord, Spearman leaps into the magical mirror to impress the Guild Gir... to fulfill his client's request!

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GS_5_01_DESC.text: An adventurer who devotes himself to slaying Goblins out of a deep hatred against them. Goblin Slayer is a skilled fighter who reached Silver Rank through defeating only Goblins. While carrying out his regular raids against Goblins with his party members, Goblin Slayer sees a Goblin Lord and his Goblin horde jump through a magical mirror that leads to another dimension. Determined to let no Goblin escape from his grasp, Goblin Slayer follows his enemies to Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GS_5_07_DESC.text: A Silver Rank adventurer, known as the "the best adventurer on the frontier," Spearman begins his search for Goblin Slayer on a quest from Guild Girl to bring the missing adventurer back. Learning that Goblin Slayer and his party teleported to a world called Hasla to chase after a Goblin Lord, Spearman leaps into the magical mirror to impress the Guild Gir... to fulfill his client's request!

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GS_6_01_DESC.text: An adventurer who devotes himself to slaying Goblins out of a deep hatred against them. Goblin Slayer is a skilled fighter who reached Silver Rank through defeating only Goblins. While carrying out his regular raids against Goblins with his party members, Goblin Slayer sees a Goblin Lord and his Goblin horde jump through a magical mirror that leads to another dimension. Determined to let no Goblin escape from his grasp, Goblin Slayer follows his enemies to Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_GS_6_07_DESC.text: A Silver Rank adventurer, known as the "the best adventurer on the frontier," Spearman begins his search for Goblin Slayer on a quest from Guild Girl to bring the missing adventurer back. Learning that Goblin Slayer and his party teleported to a world called Hasla to chase after a Goblin Lord, Spearman leaps into the magical mirror to impress the Guild Gir... to fulfill his client's request!

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_LASTSOUL_4_PUMPQUEEN.text: A witch of Pumpkin City who works at the pumpkin farm of the city. She still hasn’t graduated from Magic Academy as her timidity and lack of magical power have all but forced her to abandon her studies. Nevertheless, her skill at growing pumpkins is second to none, and she has been acknowledged by the Four Witches themselves, who have appointed the young witch the official manager of the pumpkin farm.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_LASTSOUL_5_PUMPQUEEN.text: One ordinary day, in the middle of tending to her pumpkins, Pumpqueen notices a large crowd rushing to her patches. Her initial confusion quickly turns to misery as she comes to experience the worst day of her life: the crowd turns out to be Heroes hungry for pumpkins required to participate in ‘the Great Pumpkin War,’ an event opened by the Four Great Witches. Pumpqueen tries her best to stop the mob from smashing her pumpkins with magic markers, to no avail. She sinks to the ground in despair as she helplessly watches her beloved pumpkins being bashed with markers.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_LASTSOUL_6_PUMPQUEEN.text: Pumpqueen weeps in self-pity and sorrow as she realizes that the Four Great Witches never did consider her an important witch; her appointment as manager of the pumpkin patch served no other purpose than a meaningless celebration, to which she hadn’t been truly invited. As she cries, a burning pumpkin slowly rolls to Pumpqueen’s side and begins to whisper into her ear sweet plans of revenge: why should they let those witches get away with such crimes, all for the reason that they are simply a little better at magic? The burning pumpkin hands mana collected from the surrounding magic markers to the witch. Pumpqueen dazedly accepts the magic energy, upon which she feels uncontrollable madness and strength coursing through her veins. She releases her new powers upon a nearby ruined pumpkin and appoints it her new daemon. Now a formidable ‘Pumpkin Witch,’ Pumpqueen and her daemon ‘Pumpking’ set out together for a pumpkin’s revenge against the Four Great Witches.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_OT_4_04_DESC.text: Age 35, male. A warrior and master-of-arms for a small mountain village in the Highlands.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_OT_4_07_DESC.text: Age 22, male. A thief drifting through the Cliftlands.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_OT_5_04_DESC.text: In the past he was known as the "Unbending Blade," until one day he lost king and kingdom in a bloody coup.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_OT_5_07_DESC.text: His past is a guarded secret, and his exploits are known far and wide, striking fear into the hearts of the wealthy.  「... ... And that's that.」

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_OT_6_04_DESC.text: 「To what end do I swing my blade?」 Then, one day, he heards a name from his past, giving him new purpose.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_OT_6_07_DESC.text: Then, one day, while he's sneaking into a mansion...

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_RZ_3_01_DESC.text: An ordinary boy who is teleported to a fantasy world of another dimension: the Kingdom of Lugnica. An inopportune death does not only let him fatefully meet the Half Elf Emilia, but also reveals to him the power of "Return by Death," which lets him revive to a "save point" upon death. Subaru develops deep feelings for Emilia, and vows to make her the next King of Lugnica.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_RZ_4_02_DESC.text: The Matriarch of the House of Karsten and a candidate to become the next King of Lugnica. Crusch possesses the 'Divine Protection of Wind Indication,' which lets her read the wind, detect the lies of others, and enhance her blade with Wind Mana.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_RZ_5_02_DESC.text: The Matriarch of the House of Karsten and a candidate to become the next King of Lugnica. Crusch possesses the 'Divine Protection of Wind Indication,' which lets her read the wind, detect the lies of others, and enhance her blade with Wind Mana.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_RZ_6_02_DESC.text: The Matriarch of the House of Karsten and a candidate to become the next King of Lugnica. Crusch possesses the 'Divine Protection of Wind Indication,' which lets her read the wind, detect the lies of others, and enhance her blade with Wind Mana.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_SH_4_01_DESC.text: Shield Hero Naofumi's raccoon type demi-human comrade. While waiting for the Waves of Destruction with Naofumi in the Cal Mira Islands, the adventurers unexpectedly came face-to-face with a great crack in the dimension that began to suck in everything around it. Raphtalia too was swallowed by the vortex into the Rift of Dimensions, separated from the rest of the company...

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_SH_5_01_DESC.text: Shield Hero Naofumi's raccoon type demi-human comrade. While waiting for the Waves of Destruction with Naofumi in the Cal Mira Islands, the adventurers unexpectedly came face-to-face with a great crack in the dimension that began to suck in everything around it. Raphtalia too was swallowed by the vortex into the Rift of Dimensions, separated from the rest of the company...

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_SH_6_01_DESC.text: Shield Hero Naofumi's raccoon type demi-human comrade. While waiting for the Waves of Destruction with Naofumi in the Cal Mira Islands, the adventurers unexpectedly came face-to-face with a great crack in the dimension that began to suck in everything around it. Raphtalia too was swallowed by the vortex into the Rift of Dimensions, separated from the rest of the company...

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_SPR_4_TWILLY_DESC.text: Ana Heinkel had been right all along. Had the House of Tasitte not retained Twillie's blade, everything would have gone as planned. Twillie was the one factor that the pride of Heinkel had overlooked - the one factor that had led to failure.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_SPR_5_TWILLY_DESC.text: For every battle Twillie led her soldiers at the vanguard, never failing a single mission. Her illustrious greatsword, bearing the honor of the House of Tasitte, struck fear again and again into the hearts of her enemies, never losing its dignity even in the dust of the battlefields.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_SPR_6_TWILLY_DESC.text: It was to be the last battle. The plains over which each army would take its last stand was cool for the season, but the sunlight shone as in peaceful spring. Only the wind whispered in fear, and great silence rumbled through the earth. The moment everything came to a standstill, the plains erupted with the shouts of war - and amidst them, the two women who would decide the tide of fate turned to face each other.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_TNT_4_RANNO_DESC.text: Many centuries ago, after the age of the colossal dinosaurs ended but before any trace of human civilization came into being, was the Great Cold Age. Ranno was one human girl struggling to survive in the dangerous wilderness of such times, armed with nothing save for her courage, ingenuity, and own two hands. Unlike her predators, Ranno has no hard teeth or sharp claws to boast of, but she is able to make useful tools that greatly aid her survival. Ranno so hides from the keen eyes of monsters and lives on small animals and fish caught with her traps. One day, Ranno stumbles upon a wounded young dinosaur. At first she considers cooking him up for some good meat, but when the dinosaur cowers away from her in fear and despair, Ranno sees herself in him and changes her mind.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_TNT_5_RANNO_DESC.text: Ranno finally decides to take care of the little dinosaur. Knowing that carnivorous dinosaurs are dangerous even when they are young and injured, Ranno keeps her distance and instead uses her fishing rod to throw him meals of freshly caught fish. She also earnestly tends to his wounds, and the young dinosaur slowly heals and recovers his strength. When he starts regarding Ranno as his new mother and following her around everywhere, Ranno names the dinosaur 'Rex.' However, it soon turns out that Rex never learned how to hunt from his birth mother, and Ranno's meals are not enough for a growing dinosaur, no matter how much she hunts in a day. After some contemplation, Ranno climbs onto Rex's back with her fishing rod, with which she dangles a big chunk of meat before Rex's eyes. The hungry Rex starts chasing after the meat before him, gnashing his teeth. The dinosaur so begins to 'hunt' as his consciously chomping jaws sometimes luckily land on unsuspecting prey under Ranno's guidance, even without his realizing it.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_TNT_6_RANNO_DESC.text: Ranno and Rex's new method of collaborative hunting successfully yields them a feast of meat. The proud Ranno jangles her fishing rod in a victory dance - causing its string to break and its bait to fly off. Rex instinctively leaps after the meat and, before Ranno can stop him, dives into the frigid waters. After some time, Ranno manages to coax Rex up to the surface and swim together to land. The landscape that greets their eyes, however, is a strange and unfamiliar one: the jungles of their home have been replaced by a desolate tundra. Although Ranno and Rex do not know it, they had been frozen alive in the icy sea and had only awoken tens of thousands of years later by a powerful earthquake. The shocked Ranno remains rooted to her spot and only comes to her senses when a missile hits the ground near her and Rex. Finding themselves surrounded by an army of rather hostile penguins, the duo decides to make a run for it into the unknown.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_4_ADOL_DESC.text: A red-haired adventurer and swordsman of exceptional skill. From his childhood, Adol grew up listening to great stories of legends and myths in faraway lands. Throughout his life, he comes to embark on countless adventures of his own, leaving behind more than a hundred adventure logs and journals.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_4_DANA_DESC.text: The girl who continuously appears in Adol's dreams. Dana is originally from the ancient Kingdom of Eternia, a long extinct civilization whose capital, Aegias, had stood in the northern regions of the Isle of Seiren. After much training, Dana had become the 'Maiden of the Great Tree' to reign over the kingdom together with the king, leading their people to golden prosperity. However, after having a vision of the end of the world, Dana decides to fight against that destiny and seals herself into a long slumber.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_4_LAXIA_DESC.text: The proud daughter of the Roswell family, a noble house of Garman. Her noble upbringing however, does not always keep her temper from boiling to the surface.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_5_ADOL_DESC.text: Adol embarks the passenger ship 'Lombardia' as a sailor. After the liner sinks due to a sudden attack of a mysterious sea creature, Adol wakes up on white sandy shores - realizing that he has been washed ashore on the Isle of Seiren, the "island forever cursed."

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_5_DANA_DESC.text: In her dreams, Dana comes to meet a red-haired man, sharing his mind and helping him in his adventures. After a long time, the red-haired man and his company finally meet Dana, sealed at the base of the Great Tree.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_5_LAXIA_DESC.text: After the passenger ship Lombardia sinks to the attack of a mysterious sea creature, Laxia finds herself on the unchartered Isle of Seiren. She is the first to meet Adol, another castaway, and join him to explore the island.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_6_ADOL_DESC.text: Together with his companions, Adol builds Castaway Village and rescues survivors of the shipwreck to find a way to escape the Isle of Seiren. During his endeavors, he comes to meet Dana, the blue-haired girl of his dreams, and decides to help her recover her memories. While studying the ruins of Ancient Aegias for this purpose, Adol accidentally touches a mysterious Energy Crystal - from which a mysterious power flows out to teleport them to the dimension of Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_6_DANA_DESC.text: The awakened Dana shares a mental connection with Adol and has no recollection of her memories save for the ones she has made in Castaway Village. In order to recover her memories, she joins the company to explore the ruins of Aegias. When they discover a great hole in the ruins of the palace, Dana suddenly feels excruciating pain in her head. At the same time, a Energy Crystal nearby resonates to create a disruption in time and space - teleporting the company to the dimension of Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMITED_YS8_6_LAXIA_DESC.text: Laxia initially struggles to get along with the survivors at Castaway Village, unused to interacting with people of such various classes and careers. However, after enduring many hardships together, she comes to accept them as companions and opens up as a human being. After meeting Dana, she agrees to help her recover her memories and goes to explore the northern side of the Isle of Seiren - when a mysterious power from the Energy Crystal teleports them to Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMTED_FOURTH_4_REDNAS_DESC.text: A skilled young knight of Grancia Empire who has shown great talent with a sword from an early age. Her worth, skill, and valor have already been proven during her apprentice years, when she successfully and repeatedly protected important figures of the Order of the Goddess from harm. Even years later, many recall the great competition that took place among the numerous orders and noble families after Lednas's knighting ceremony as each had wished to claim her as their own knight.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMTED_FOURTH_5_REDNAS_DESC.text: Yet despite the expectations of many others, Lednas is assigned as the Hero Captain of Hero Town, a small village in the Empire. Although many knights and nobles express their disappointment at Lednas's "talent wasting in some country village," only a few are aware of the true nature of Lednas's assignment, decreed by the Emperor himself: to investigate and settle a series of inexplicable events occurring near Hero Town.

TEXT_CHA_WA_LIMTED_FOURTH_6_REDNAS_DESC.text: The "strange events" around Hero Town turn out to be far more dangerous than anyone has expected. Heroes begin to lose consciousness and turn on their allies, and Lednas's own troops are not an exception. Lednas, struggling to keep the darkness at bay, requests the Empire for another Hero Captain to aid her efforts. And thus, Lednas comes to cross paths with the new Hero Captain, neither one of them aware that their meeting will change each other's destinies forever.

TEXT_CHA_WA_SUPPORT_3_1_DESC.text: A young boy who lost his parents in the war and must now take care of his younger siblings on his own. One day, he comes across a suspicious advertisement offering large sums of money for test subjects. The boy decides to sign up for the experiment for the sake of his family. [This Hero is required to reinforce Champions.]

TEXT_CHA_WA_SUPPORT_4_1_DESC.text: The boy despairs, for he feels the memories of his family fading away as his body is gradually replaced with biomechatronic parts. His only treasured possession is an old necklace given to him by his brother, the only memento of his past. [This Hero is required to reinforce Champions.]

TEXT_CHA_WA_SUPPORT_5_1_DESC.text: One day, the boy wakes up in a barracks. He soon realizes that his body has been further enhanced and that he has been deployed on a battlefield for real combat. Will he survive? [This Hero is required to reinforce Champions.]

TEXT_CHA_WA_SUPPORT_6_1_DESC.text: The boy survives. However, in order to avoid his inevitable return to the laboratory, he feigns death and escapes from the battlefield. He now has only one goal: find his family, the one that still calls to him from the depths of his now faint memories. [This Hero is required to reinforce Champions.]

TEXT_CHA_WA_UNIQUE_4_JARYONG_DESC.text: His father was the sole descendant of a famous clan. He showed potential in martial arts since a young age. He was raised as upright as his father, and one day, he went to meet a man along with his father.

TEXT_CHA_WA_UNIQUE_4_RAEL_DESC.text: The granddaughter of Margrave Laertes. Rael has trained earnestly from her childhood to become a great knight like her grandfather. When Soltar revives in the Fortress of Souls years later, Rael is prepared to lead fellow volunteer soldiers to the battlefield and protect the lands of Valencia. Those who have watched her in battle call Rael ‘the Young Margrave’ and praise her as a hero befitting the throne of the kingdom.

TEXT_CHA_WA_UNIQUE_5_JARYONG_DESC.text: This man that was said to have sparred with his father in the past was the former Five Tiger General Shuwen. Shuwen was impressed by Zilong's skills and potential, and began sparring with him every day. He trained like that for years, and he improved by leaps and bounds, enough to go out to the battlefield. He was determined to fight for his country, and was able to win against great armies with his combat skills and minimize losses with brilliant strategies. His performance during a time when the Five Tiger Generals were absent led to the people praising him as their new hero.  Soon after, Zilong was named as one of the Five Tiger Generals.

TEXT_CHA_WA_UNIQUE_5_RAEL_DESC.text: Near the end of the war, a mysterious knight by the name of Lionel suddenly appears and defeats Soltar, revealing that he is no other than Soltar’s own descendant. As people’s respect and admiration are quickly transferred from her to the dark knight, whose royal heritage win support from all to enthrone him as Valencia’s long-lost king – Rael feels a dark rage consuming her from within. The Young Margrave attempts to attack Lionel during his coronation but fails, leaving her no choice but to flee. She finally finds herself before the Fortress of Souls, soldiers of the kingdom pursuing her from all sides.

TEXT_CHA_WA_UNIQUE_6_JARYONG_DESC.text: After being appointed as a Five Tiger General, Zilong began to see the other side of the country that he hadn't seen before. He realized why Shuwen had given up his position. He began to question what was going on with his country and the emperor, and began investigating along with Hansheng.

TEXT_CHA_WA_UNIQUE_6_RAEL_DESC.text: Rael becomes the new Lord of the Fortress of Souls by consuming the Apostle’s lingering energy. Thus empowered, she seeks revenge on Lionel – but ends up losing control of her body to the ghost of Soltar. Rael’s soul shatters into fragments which scatter all throughout the Fortress. The Young Margrave, wandering in the dark, quietly succumbs to despair and remorse for her past actions… when she feels the pieces of her soul gathering. How much time has passed? She does not know, but Rael awakens when her soul finally becomes whole once more. The Young Margrave learns that Lionel, after ascending to the throne, strived day and night to save her soul. Finally acknowledging her own foolishness, Rael swears fealty to her new king.

TEXT_CHA_WI_1_11_DESC.text: A magician who dared to openly criticize the Cardinal and had to flee from continued attempts at his life. He now lives alone in the sewers, hiding from the world, ready to attack anyone whom he deems an intruder.

TEXT_CHA_WI_1_12_DESC.text: A scholar studying the ancient civilization of the Desert. He travels to the Temple of Illusions in hopes of making a new discovery.

TEXT_CHA_WI_1_13_DESC.text: All this little girl ever wanted in life was to grow just a little taller. She spends up every night praying that she will loom over everyone else one day.

TEXT_CHA_WI_1_14_DESC.text: A clone created from Galatea's genes. After a recent revelation, he's attempting to find his "true individual self," distinct from the other clones who are always the same.

TEXT_CHA_WI_1_15_DESC.text: A monk that chose to become a monk in order to shave his head and hide his hair loss. Unexpectedly, he trained well and opened his eyes to Ethereal magic.

TEXT_CHA_WI_2_15_DESC.text: A noble lady of a renowned family in Trista. Despite her formidable status, she is rather innocent, and dreams of learning love spells to capture the heart of the true love of her life.

TEXT_CHA_WI_2_16_DESC.text: A manager of Vibhrinium, an essential material used to create levitating stones. She is locked within the Temple by the Three Kings for her superior knowledge on Vibhrinium development so that the technology firmly remains within the Desert Kingdom.

TEXT_CHA_WI_2_17_DESC.text: A resident of Snorri Edda, the capital of Nosgard. She moved to Nosgard from a hot region of the continent, but is now considering moving away again to escape the ravaging cold.

TEXT_CHA_WI_2_18_DESC.text: A robot dog once popular in the Neth Empire. Did it lose its owner in the war? Or has it been abandoned on purpose? No one knows, but ever since the war, it has been always waiting for its master in the same place.

TEXT_CHA_WI_2_19_DESC.text: A librarian working at the imperial library. She is infatuated after reading about the legendary Team Mint Chocolate from a book in the section of banned books.

TEXT_CHA_WI_3_17_DESC.text: A magician who has been conducting research under the Cardinal's orders. Earnest, diligent, and fastidious, she's a great favorite of her bosses, but is rather disliked by her colleagues.

TEXT_CHA_WI_3_18_DESC.text: A scientist of Hasla with a charismatic deep voice and superior knowledge of foreign languages. He is strong enough to fend for himself, as he has often done so on his travels to study the ancient civilizations of the Desert. Although he walks his path alone for the time being, he knows that there will be light at the end of the road. With every new day, he will step out once more into the Desert with renewed hope, and his friends will always look out for him in their hearts. - In memory of our dear friend, Team CQ. -

TEXT_CHA_WI_3_19_DESC.text: The girl, awakened from her dreams, searches for her father, but no kind voice answers her. Teardrops freeze on her cheek, with no gentle hand to wipe them away...

TEXT_CHA_WI_3_20_DESC.text: An assistant researcher at Neth Empire. She's been doing her work efficiently to avoid any overtime... but thanks to her proficiency, she's been receiving more work than before from her seniors.

TEXT_CHA_WI_3_21_DESC.text: Royal emissary Mondrian's footman. He was looking forward to become successful once Mondrian became a high-ranking official, so he was disappointed when Mondrian chose to become a royal emissary.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_22_DESC.text: A trickster who enjoys clever disguises and troublesome deceptions. One day, Loki comes across a tribal village in the snowy plains of Nosgard. Seeing the villagers' happy lives irritates Loki, who desires to see "something fun" - and so the clown begins to devise the cleverest trick he has ever carried out.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_23_DESC.text: Han Xiangzi learns quickly - and becomes bored twice as quickly. With seemingly nothing more to study, the prodigy spends all his days lounging about at home and wondering at the extent of his own knowledge. One fateful day, Han Xiangzi catches the attention of He Xiangu, who offers him an opportunity to become their pupil and train for the path of Ethereals. While Han Xiangzi isn't too fond of the idea of training hard for anything, he is certainly interested in becoming an Ethereal, and so sets out with his new teachers.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_24_DESC.text: The chief of the Tribe of Winter Wind, a people that lived in ancient Nosgard. The Winter Wind Tribe may not be the strongest clan in the history of Hasla, but the wise prophecies of their Great Oracle, Lakias's benevolent yet firm leadership, and the unified strength of the tribespeople themselves allow them victory over the harsh winters of Nosgard. The winter wind, the namesake of their tribe, is what brings these people together, and keeps them warm.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_25_DESC.text: A death angel whose job is to guide deceased souls to the underworld. Famous among other death angels - and quite proud of himself as well - for his efficiency and thoroughness, the Grim Reaper is unpleasantly surprised when a soul escapes him for the first time. Upon closer observation, he discovers that the soul had been healed by an unknown healer's spells, allowing it to cross the line back to the realm of living. The Grim Reaper becomes, understandably, quite upset by the turn of events: a stray mark in his otherwise perfect record.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_26_DESC.text: The only daughter of Ura, the Chieftain of the Onis of Onigashima. Urako spends her days in happiness with her stern but affectionate father and their kind-hearted neighbors. One day, however, a monstrous human invades the peaceful island and defeats Urako's father, stealing every last penny from his castle.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_28_DESC.text: At certain times and places in the Eastern Kingdoms, the boundaries between the living and the dead ebb and converge. Bihwa, fatefully born at one such convergence of the two realms, is drawn into the world of the dead at the moment of her birth. Bihwa's parents search day and night for their newborn child, but they know they will never find her again, as according to the centuries-old-myth: humans snatched away by ghosts are never known to return.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_29_DESC.text: From an early age, Wang Dao has been aware of his life's one and only purpose: killing the Emperor, who annihilated his entire family of Chen nobles and left him the last descendant of his line. Under his father's stern training, Wang Dao masters the secret fighting technique that has been passed down in his family for generations. If placed in Wang Dao's agile and deadly hand, any object will transform into a lethal weapon – a weapon meant for the Emperor’s throat. Only after his father passes away does Wang Dao decide to become an acrobat, calculating that the unassuming role will gain him easier access to the imperial ball. He begins to learn the art of bian lian, or face-changing: a task he finds to come easily to his already trained hands.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_30_DESC.text: The magical seamstress Labelle designs and sews clothes with thread drawn out from others' mana. Everyone wants to wear Labelle's clothes, as it is rumored that they reveal a hidden charm of the wearer. Labelle is soon recognized for her talents in the court as well, and she is invited to become the youngest Imperial Tailor in the history of Grancia.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_31_DESC.text: A girl born with an inherent gift for the magic of the earth. Under the unconditional support and care of her parents, Estelle easily enters the Magical Academy of Pumpkin City. Her talents are much coveted even at the Academy due to the uncommon nature of earth magic, and the beloved young witch graduates with excellent marks and much success. Afterwards, at the recommendation of Principal Wolfram herself, Estelle is accepted to the Magic Laboratories of Loviatar, the famed witch of the earth.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_32_DESC.text: An orphan who struggles to survive in the harsh borderlands of Chen, ravaged by the long drought. Exhausted with despair and hunger, Shu Gwi loses all hope. He impassively waits for his death… only to be discovered by soldiers who had been patrolling the area. The unconscious Shu Gwi is covertly delivered to the Ethereal Magic Research Institute located in the capital of the kingdom, where the Ethereal wizards assign the boy with the task of copying the contents of a certain textbook of spells.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_33_DESC.text: An introverted Elf who values over everything else her own secluded corner of the forest. Aiming to make her personal space 'perfect,' Éfendére begins to research magic that maximizes the speed of plant growth. With her natural talent and obsessive effort, she quickly gains full control over the plants of her forest, which rapidly grow to full bloom under her fingers. Éfendére gazes at her flowers and trees in satisfaction.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_34_DESC.text: A lieutenant colonel and scientist of the Neth Army, Caroline is renowned for her groundbreaking technology and many inventions including unmanned drones and combat AI. Her newest innovation is the ‘teleporter,’ her life’s work which will solidify her prestigious position of power. However, during the grand demonstration of the teleporter, a girl wielding a hammer appears out of nowhere and ruins Caroline’s career. Blinded by her desire for revenge, Caroline makes numerous irreversible mistakes and is ultimately captured by the enemy Revolutionary Army. As a last resort, Caroline codes a self-destruct command in the teleporter before passing out…

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_35_DESC.text: A girl born with an overflowing source of powerful magic and a curious spirit. To protect her ailing older sister, who is also her best friend in the world, Medea trains diligently and becomes a priestess at a young age. The compassionate and wise older sister and the ambitious, free-spirited younger sister become beloved household names in the Republic as they use their powers to help citizens young and old. Yet Medea's older sister must soon face the burden of her fate: the heavy responsibility of having been chosen as the next 'Hera.' Medea, concerned that her sister's poor health will deteriorate further with the toiling tasks of 'Hera,' voices her protests to the Olympian Council. The Council, however, decrees that once chosen, a successor cannot escape their destiny. Medea's fears are realized as Hera's condition deteriorates rapidly after embracing her title. As Medea grieves over her own helplessness, her sister promises her that she will break the vicious cycle of the despair afflicting the long line of Heras.

TEXT_CHA_WI_4_36_DESC.text: A beautiful 'pitta nympha' bird patron saint who dwells in the thickets of a river in Han. Eungaram enjoys human companionship, willingly revealing himself in his bird form and singing for those who visit his river. Yet misfortune devours his peaceful life when a greedy hunter who had been eyeing his feathers takes advantage of his friendly nature; Eungaram is captured and sold to a wealthy collector who keeps him as a pet. The bird patron saint loses his magic due to being separated from his sanctuary river, the source of his power. He turns wan and thin, and loses all trust in humans: save one. A maid with hair the color of the sea visits him every day and even decorates his cage with pretty pebbles from the nearby riverbank. Eungaram gingerly opens his heart to the girl when he sees that her care and compassion is genuine. Soon, the only true happiness in his life comes to lie in the girl's visits.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_22_DESC.text: With his forked tongue and smooth voice, Loki attempts to divide the Nosgard tribe against one another. However, the wise Tribal Chief guides the villagers against Loki's trickery, bringing them together even closer than before. The trickster is left to seethe over his failure.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_23_DESC.text: Han Xiangzi meets He Xiangu's expectations, showing natural talent at Ethereal magic. However, the long and arduous training required to become an Ethereal begins to prove tiring to Han Xiangzi - to the point that he declares that he wishes to give up his studies. He Xiangu only laughs as if they have expected such an outcome, and advises Han Xiangzi to embark on a pilgrimage to 'earn his enlightenment.' Han Xiangzi finds the prospect of new adventures agreeable and departs.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_24_DESC.text: Yet one day, a strange rumor circulates within the tribe, sowing in the people's hearts the seeds of mistrust. Only through Lakias's persuasive words do they remain united; they are brought even closer together, in fact, as if to repent their former doubts. The very next day, however, the Great Oracle makes a new prophecy.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_25_DESC.text: The Grim Reaper becomes increasingly sensitive to all kinds of healing spells, especially those that play with the boundary of life and death. After what other death angels refer to as 'that day,' the Grim Reaper begins to reap and guide deceased souls to the underworld with a firmer hand, regardless of the healing they received. The Grim Reaper receives a promotion as a result, and becomes "Manager of Revived and Ill-Placed Souls."

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_26_DESC.text: Urako's "kind" neighbors, after finding out that the once-mighty Ura is now penniless and powerless, start to treat them with scorn and contempt. Urako vows revenge on the monstrous human who forced them into such poverty.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_28_DESC.text: Thus Bihwa grows up in the realm of the dead, with only the dark ghosts as her companions. One day, two death angels appear before Bihwa, arguing that they must set straight the balance of life and death. The young girl, fearing the strange beings, uses the strength of the ghosts to flee.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_29_DESC.text: Wang Dao joins a small circus and begins his new double life as face-changer. His talents soon earn himself and the circus much fame: his nimble techniques of changing his masks and emotional performances charm all who come to see him. Years pass, and Wang Dao and his circus come to be known throughout the country of Chen, “their popularity rising to the heavens,” as one critic praises them. When the imperial family invites the circus to the palace, Wang Dao secretly smiles at the Emperor’s foolishness, sure that his certain death is not too far ahead.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_30_DESC.text: One day, a knight named Morgan visits and rudely orders a custom-fit wardrobe. Labelle replies that her books are full and that he needs to make the proper reservations—at which Morgan starts trashing her atelier and ripping apart the other customers’ dresses. Labelle has no choice but to acquiesce to his threats. She soon discovers, however, that Morgan’s mana is dirty and black as tar, unfit to make any article of clothing. After some pondering, Labelle comes up with a plan.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_31_DESC.text: Estelle continues her studies under Loviatar's guidance. In the beginning, the younger witch - once considered a genius at the Academy - struggles to understand even the basics of Loviatar's complicated research. Loviatar soon discerns her brilliance, however, when she sees Estelle's original method of collecting earth mana from the celestial bodies in the sky. She allows Estelle to pursue her own research, but before the latter can finish her thesis on 'celestial magic,' Loviatar disappears.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_32_DESC.text: The book of magic turns out to be written in an indecipherable ancient text. While Shu Gwi does not understand its contents, simply staring at the strange letters exhaust his mind. He later learns that many Ethereal wizards who attempted to study the book lost their sanity, overwhelmed by its power. Shu Gwi, however, remains unscathed due to having lost all his emotions during his encounter with death. Seeing the extent of his achievements, the Ethereal wizards take him to the Ethereal master of the imperial court, who recognizes Shu Gwi’s talent and decides to make him their apprentice.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_33_DESC.text: One winter day, Linné comes across Éfendére's forest, which is still vibrant with newly sprouted flowers as if it were spring. Puzzled, she begins to investigate the area. Linné soon stumbles upon Éfendére, who immediately recognizes Hasla's most renowned botanist and seizes on the opportunity to show off her forest. Éfendére also demonstrates to Linné her advanced plant growth magic, by which the smallest buds immediately burst to maturity. After watching Éfendére's proud display, however, the botanist gingerly warns the other Elf that such magic consumes energy of the earth itself and could shorten the lifespan of the forest. Éfendére, however, regards Linné's advice as mere jealousy and pays it no heed.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_34_DESC.text: Now a war criminal and a fugitive on the run, Levine Ludovico furtively attempts to contact other aristocrats and receive reinforcements to reclaim control. However, the other nobles remain passive out of fear of Yuria and her connections with the Ancient Being of ‘Heaven.’ At last, Levine decides to use the technology of Heaven that she extorted through her coup d’etat to devise her way out of her dilemma herself. After much toiling in her private ‘Third Secret Underground Laboratory,’ Levine succeeds in inventing the ‘teleporter.’ She navigates the many alternate dimensions in search of one in which she defeated the Hero Captain. The very moment she activates the teleporter, however, she finds herself face-to-face with Caroline from the universe of ‘Ride Zero.’

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_35_DESC.text: Medea, observing her sister closely, discovers that Hera’s illness is not physiological in nature. With each passing day, the young priestess comes to sense more acutely the nameless darkness that torments Hera… and her eyes come to rest on the sapphire ring that shines on Hera’s white hands. Medea continuously supplicates before the Council to examine the ominous nature of the rings, but her beseeches are met with cool silence. Even Hera herself stubbornly refuses to let Medea investigate the matter further, claiming that this is her predestined path. Time passes, and Hera fades; Medea finds that despite all her endeavors, she cannot save her sister. When Hera’s health rapidly deteriorates, the Council hastily brings an orphan girl before the comatose senator to serve as her successor. As all eyes watch the girl as she inherits all the memories and powers of Hera, only Medea’s gaze is fixed on her sister’s dying breath.

TEXT_CHA_WI_5_36_DESC.text: As the days pass and pebble after colorful pebble fills the floor of the cage, Eungaram discovers that his magical powers and voice have returned. The bird patron saint belatedly realizes that the girl must have picked up the pebbles from the banks of his river. The overjoyed Eungaram reveals his true identity to the girl and thanks her for her care, promising her that if she opens the doors of his cage, he will return for her. The girl, initially startled by the river spirit's revelation, agrees to his request. Eungaram unfurls his wings to the wind and loses himself to the wide expanse of the open sky, the girl sincerely wishing him happiness at his back. After a few days during which he recovers his full strength, Eungaram returns to his former slaver's mansion, his heart full of anticipation at seeing the girl's smile again. But the future he dreamt of is no more. The girl had paid the price for Eungaram's freedom with her own life; after being branded a thief and receiving harsh punishment at the hands of her master, she had left the realm of the living for the distant land of shadows.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_15_CQSIMY_HATE.text: Don't do that, meow! We need to get to work!

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_22_DESC.text: As a final resort, Loki disguises himself as a renowned sorcerer. He then tells the Tribal Chief a false prophecy, persuading him to retreat into the heart of a glacier and pray for one hundred days in order to avoid the wrath of the heavens. With the Tribal Chief out of the way, Loki easily plants seeds of suspicion and hatred into the heart of the tribal village. War breaks out, and the tribe comes to destroy itself. Yet in the midst of its ruins, Loki, gleeful with his masterpiece of mayhem and destruction, only laughs and goes to seek his next victims.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_23_DESC.text: Han Xiangzi soon forgets He Xiangu's advice and lightheartedly continues on his journey. When he comes across a group of merchants besieged by bandits, he rescues them with his magic only to show off his abilities. It is only before the merchants' gratitude that he realizes the joy of helping others for the very first time in his life. When the merchants beg him for his name, the happy Han Xiangzi only gives the short answer of "an Ethereal" and vanishes, his teachers' words long forgotten in his mind.
