TEXT_CHA_WI_6_24_DESC.text: The prophecy of the Great Oracle is an ominous one, portending great tragedy: if the Chief of the Tribe does not offer prayer to the gods for one hundred full days, the whole Tribe of the Winter Wind shall be cursed with the greatest plague that they have known. As the Great Oracle is never wrong, Lakias travels to the Sanctuary of Nosgard to start her prayers. At the moment she utters the first verse, however, a great avalanche traps her within its icy glaciers and puts her under enchanted sleep. Hundreds of years later, on a fateful spring day, Lakias finally awakens from her slumber.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_25_DESC.text: Thanks to the Grim Reaper's efforts, the balance between life and death is set straight - or almost so, for attempts to save lives through the power of healing continue. Yet the underworld has nothing to fear with the Grim Reaper doing his job. Even today he travels the battlefields and sickbeds of Hasla, (rather irritably) looking for souls that have met their time and are ready to pass on. No soul escapes the Grim Reaper's eye!

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_26_DESC.text: Urako starts for the country of Ryu, intent on hunting down the human. However, a Kitsune spirit, a Tengu, and a Nue block her path, worried for the beloved daughter of the Chieftain for whom their respect has gone unchanged. When Urako refuses to return home, the three spirits join the young Oni on her journey. After many hardships, the four friends finally arrive in Ryu, and Urako manages to track down her victim. The time has come for her to swing her kanabo and get her revenge! But what's this? When she meets the eyes of the 'monstrous human,' Urako discovers, to her complete surprise, that he doesn't look so "monstrous" after all. Her heart beating furiously like it has never before, Urako lowers her kanabo and flees from embarrassment, muttering about "revenge best served cold." What are these feelings tickling her heart, she wonders?

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_28_DESC.text: In time, Bihwa comes to accept the powers of the ghosts that stay by her side. More years pass, and Bihwa grows into a formidable presence feared by all living mortals, who call her the 'Soulless Empress.' One day, a ghost donned with a traditional mask of Han appears before Bihwa with the message that his master can help her. Bihwa, grown weary from the deep desolation that has tormented her since the moment of her birth, sets out with a final shred of hope in her cold heart.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_29_DESC.text: The day of the concert soon arrives. Finally finding himself at the palace, Wang Dao begins acting out his best performance, accompanied by a band of palace musicians and dancers. Every one of the audience ooh’s and aah’s before his transformative stage, and even the Emperor bends his neck to look at his masks more closely. At the climax of the performance, Wang Dao aims a specially sharpened mask at the Emperor’s neck – only to have it flung from its initial trajectory by the fan of one dancer near him. The shaken Wang Dao, who has never before considered failure, only barely grabs ahold of his senses and prepares to throw another deadly mask. Yet the dancer’s movements continue to obstruct the face-changer’s path, and Wang Dao must force himself to end his routine when the music ends. It may be an artist’s success, but at the same time it is an assassin’s failure. Amidst the standing ovation, Wang Dao only bitterly smiles, glares at the dancer who foiled his lifetime’s worth of plans, and makes his exit. The next day, the whole court is abuzz with news of the face-changer’s sudden disappearance. He is never seen after that day, but rumors whisper that the face-changer, his true face hidden behind his masks, is still performing, disguised as a simple face in a crowd.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_29_NAME.text: Master of Bian Lian, Wang Dao

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_30_DESC.text: After a few days, Labelle visits Morgan, claiming that his clothes are finished. She stretches out her hands before the knight, explaining that she has successfully produced “the finest clothes in the Empire, invisible to those who are greedy.” Morgan’s hypocritical minions fawn over Labelle’s empty hands, and Morgan, not wishing to seem foolish before his soldiers, reluctantly pays the seamstress her due. After days of suppressed rage and vehemence, Morgan decides he will not let the insult go and secretly sends an assassin to attack Labelle. This isn’t over!

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_31_DESC.text: Estelle searches high and low for Loviatar, but years pass by without revealing even a trace of the vanished witch. Wolfram finally asks her to help lead the witches of Pumpkin City by becoming the next Great Witch of Earth, but Estelle refuses the offer. Instead, she declares that she will continue to research the 'celestial magic' that she developed with Loviatar's help, and teach young witches whose talents do not completely fit in with the four established fields of magic. Thus Estelle, now respectfully called 'the Witch of Stars,' becomes the newest and one of the most beloved professors at the Magic Academy.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_32_DESC.text: Together with the Ethereal master, Shu Gwi studies the knowledge hidden within the ancient book of magic. He comes to lead a luxurious life in court that he never would have dreamed of before, but Shu Gwi, devoid of any emotion, remains immersed only in the unfathomable contents of the book. One day, a voice seeps out from within the volume. The voice whispers that it had been captured by Ethereals and tortured for years in their hands - and begs Shu Gwi to free it from its chains. Shu Gwi, for the first time in years, feels a sliver of empathy to the voice, drawn by its echoing loneliness and hunger. He frees the binds of the volume and escapes, the book clutched tightly in his arms.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_32_NAME.text: Shu Gwi of the Flowering Brush

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_33_DESC.text: Not too long after, Éfendére - in the middle of her daily routine of looking after her home - discovers that the flowers she 'grew' only the day before have withered overnight. She nonchalantly recasts her growth spell over the blossoms and brushes off the incident as mere coincidence. However, only a few hours pass before the same flowers lose their bright colors - and this time, the entire forest begins to wither. Éfendére refuses to accept the limitations of her abilities and, in a desperate attempt, uses the last remaining energy of the earth to restore her forest to perfection. Yet Éfendére's paradise, once filled with beauty and life, only continues to disintegrate into desolation and death. Despairing, Éfendére clutches the last of her fading blossoms. She realizes that she must acknowledge the fact that she cannot revive her forest on her own. Having come to this conclusion, Éfendére sets out of her home - the first time in a long while - in order to ask for Linné's help in restoring life to her forest.

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_34_DESC.text: Unbeknownst to Levine, the Caroline she has met does not come from the world of ‘Ride Zero’ but is instead a mad scientist from a dimension ruled by the monster ‘Chaotic Apocalypse Ent.’ After waiting for her alternate selves to invent the ‘teleporter’ in their respective dimensions, the ‘Apocalyptic’ Caroline would invade and conquer that world with the device acting as a medium – then absorb her parallel self in energy form. The Apocalyptic Caroline had already absorbed the Caroline of the Ride Zero universe and had been hungrily eying her next victim: Levine, the ‘Caroline’ of the original Hasla. This time, however, Levine’s superior magical engineering technology piques the interest of Caroline, who decides to postpone her conquest of Hasla. Instead, Caroline orders Levine to build a new ultrasonic weapon that shares the mechanism of the Road Industry defense system. Levine certainly has her uses, and Caroline snickers as she imagines another apocalypse overcoming this world – this time in the form of D-CAT, the “devil’s music” that will turn Hasla into living hell…

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_35_DESC.text: The Council that tore their family apart… Her own sister who broke her final promise… The new Hera, too young and innocent to fully comprehend the weight that has been forced onto her shoulders… Medea does not know whom she must blame for her grief, but she does know that she cannot let herself be silenced by anyone. After the birth of the new Hera, Medea begins to dedicate all her waking hours to investigating the rings of the Olympian Council: their true purpose, their powers, the reason behind the Council’s long tradition of handing them down across generations… As time passes, the priestess’s mind, once burning brightly with keen intelligence and purpose, narrows down to a festering obsession that knows no bounds. Her increasingly dangerous experiments result in accidents both serious and trivial, and she is soon captured by the Council and indicted for her crimes. Medea escapes, however, never to be seen again in the Roman Republic. There are still rumors that she is still watching from the shadows, however, seething with revenge and grief… Could the strange occurrences around the stone forests of Pumpkin City have anything to do with her?

TEXT_CHA_WI_6_36_DESC.text: Eungaram's frail sobs drown out even the ferocious current of his river until they dwindle down to a tired, empty silence. The guardian of the river gazes upon what remains of his former slaver's mansion, now ravaged by the rapids. With one last sorrowful look, he disappears among the thickets of his river. Tortured by the knowledge that he has failed to save the one human he wished to protect, Eungaram keeps to himself until the resounding screams of mountain spirits rouse him to attention. His curiousity piqued, the river patron saint ventures to the nearby human village for the first time in decades. The scene that meets his eyes is a startling one: humans entrapping patron saints and burning their mountains, patron saints huddled in their cages like mere beasts... Eungaram hurriedly summons the guardians of the surrounding mountain range to build a protective nest of water, effectively preventing further harm. Humans flee, fearing the appearance of a patron saint who has not lost his powers. With no one able to explain the chaos and no sign of the mayhem dying down, Eungaram leaves his home. He must find Hanee Baram, his old friend and head of the saints; perhaps she will find a way. As he departs for the long journey with a sinking heart, Eungaram slips his hand into his pocket and caresses the pebbles of his riverbank.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_AUTO_4_NICOLA_DESC.text: A Green Elf who works at the multinational volunteer organization 'Christmas.' Nicola loves children so much that she voluntarily researches methods by which she can deliver delicious treats to more children around the world with increased speed and accuracy. After years of improving candy recipes and honing her delivery skills, Nicola ultimately succeeds in inventing a special type of 'Candy Delivery Magic.'

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_AUTO_5_NICOLA_DESC.text: Armed with her special magic, the ambitious Elf starts delivering gifts, throwing candy into children's arms more speedily and accurately than any other Elf. However, her methods of candy delivery turn out to be a little TOO fast for children, who become severely injured due to Nicola's powerful throws. Nicola, shocked at the fact that she has hurt the very children she had sworn to make happy, hands in her notice to aimlessly wander the streets.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_AUTO_6_NICOLA_DESC.text: A few days later, Nicola, still self-exiled to the streets, is visited by Santa himself. Santa consoles the depressed Elf, assuring her that even if the results were less than desirable, her sincere love for children cannot be doubted by anyone. He suggests to Nicola that she delivers the presents to the children's parents instead, as they are more physically capable of dealing with her magic. Awed at Santa's wisdom, Nicola returns to 'Christmas' and becomes the leader of the 'Candy Couriers,' who are devoted to learning and practicing her Candy Delivery Magic. Shortly after her return, however, rumors spread among the fearful people of Hasla of a mysterious assassin whose choice of weapon is candy harder than metal...

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_AUTUMN_4_ANZU_DESC.text: Deep in the valleys of Ryu can be found the Forest of Eternal Autumn, where no human feet dare to tread. Yet one afternoon, golden with the light that streams through the rustling ginkgo leaves, a solitary girl wanders into the forest, dragging her heavily wounded body and her equally wounded soul. She has given up her will to live, and her dying wish is to close her eyes in a quiet, well-lighted place. In the embrace of a ginkgo tree, Anzu loses her consciousness, unaware that a small shadow intently watches her. The shadow starts to move: the only movement in the quiet forest, save for the wind.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_AUTUMN_5_ANZU_DESC.text: The sunlight streaming through the ginkgo leaves awakens Anzu. Anzu may not know how long she has been sleeping, but she knows by the clean bandages and the array of berries by her bedside that someone has been nursing her. But who can it be? The shadow soon reveals itself before Anzu: a girl who calls herself "Kaede the Ninja." Anzu cannot help but be wary of Kaede's raccoon ears and tail - half-forgotten in the ninja's haste to introduce herself - but soon opens her heart to the endearing raccoon-girl, whose love and care melt away Anzu's caution. Kaede begins to teach Anzu all the knowledge and skills she has learned through her years of transforming into a human ninja, and Anzu devotes herself to Kaede's lessons with glittering eyes.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_AUTUMN_6_ANZU_DESC.text: And so Anzu begins to heal. With Kaede's help, she has become stronger in both body and soul, and now her heart sways toward the path of the wind: the path by which the wind travels, going beyond the forest and into the wider expanse of the world. Anzu too has gone beyond the tragedy of her childhood as an orphan without a home, a friend, or a desire to live, and she is now ready to experience the world. This wish grows bigger and bigger within her heart, and soon becomes a gale that engulfs all her waking hours. It does not take long for Kaede to notice Anzu's such desire. Kaede holds out her hand to Anzu: they will always be together, Kaede and Anzu, wherever they may go. Following the ginkgo leaves that the wind carries on its back, Anzu, with her beloved friend, steps out of the forest.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_EAST_4_FREDERICK_DES.text: Fredrick was abandoned with his twin sister Francesca at the orphanage of the Order of the Goddess. But that orphanage was being operated by a faction known as the 'Follower of Arart', and the twins were transferred to the Grand Cathedral of Elandia. In the underground of the cathedral, the followers of Arart conducted inhumane experiments to create an artificial Goddess. The twins were separated and Fredrick was locked up alone, away from Francesca.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_EAST_5_FREDERICK_DES.text: As the experiments for the artificial Goddess continued on, the orphans that were dragged there were transformed and slowly died one by one. Fredrick survived with just a big scar on his forehead. The holy energy from him got stronger by the day, and the followers of Arart began treating him differently. Fredrick was able to leave the underground prison, and was treated with the utmost devotion in the monastery. But the brainwashing from the Order only got stronger, and by the time he was ready for the final experiment, he had forgotten everything about his twin sister and had become a loyal follower of the Order.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_EAST_6_FREDERICK_DES.text: The final experiment at the Room of Blessing ended, and Fredrick was reborn as the container of pure light. But as a result of the experiment, all the other followers that were nearby him had died. Fredrick was standing cluelessly, when the other followers that were outside dragged him to an unknown woman. She looked at Fredrick with her one eye, and satisfied, gave the order to create more beings like him. Years passed, and the followers of Arart made advances in the research based on Fredrick's body, and were finally able to succeed in creating the blessed being, Noah. The followers of Arart were able to create the artificial Goddess, so they tried to tell Fredrick about his twin sister and get rid of him. Fredrick was connected to Francesca through the stigmata on his body, and he was able to survive the experiments because she took on the traces of darkness. He was an incomplete being. Fredrick was devastated by the realization and was ready to face his death, when two shadows appeared in the cathedral.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_ER_4_05_DESC.text: The fifth Eto Ranger Drago has a calm and cool personality, and together with Gao are the "adults" of the bunch. Hearing that the Jyarei Monsters are assaulting a new world called Hasla, he leaps into action with the other Eto Rangers.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_ER_4_21_DESC.text: Nyanma is the commander of the dark forces trying to destroy Mugen out of hatred for Princess Aura. Having sent Jyarei Monsters to Novel Worlds only to be defeated time and time again, Nyanma drew the ire of Jyarei Goddess Bagi. This time, she heads to the new world of Hasla with her monsters in order to redeem herself.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_ER_5_05_DESC.text: The fifth Eto Ranger Drago has a calm and cool personality, and together with Gao are the "adults" of the bunch. Hearing that the Jyarei Monsters are assaulting a new world called Hasla, he leaps into action with the other Eto Rangers.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_GG3_4_DIZZY_DESC.text: A half-Gear born between a human father and a Gear mother. Initially appearing a normal human infant, Dizzy is found and raised by an old couple until her rapid growth raises suspicions among the villagers. Fully grown at a young and unnatural age, Dizzy is forced to leave the village and live in the woods by herself.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_GG3_5_DIZZY_DESC.text: Day after day, Dizzy fends off attacks from humans who have discovered her true identity. At her limit, Dizzy finally loses to Sol Badguy, who retains Gear powers similar to her own. Yet Dizzy is saved when she is taken in by Johnny of the Jellyfish Pirates. Johnny promises her safety and a place in his crew, and Dizzy begins to slowly heal from her distrust of humans.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_GG3_6_DIZZY_DESC.text: Along with a peaceful life arrives true love in the form of Ky Kiske, captain of the International Police Force. Dizzy soon gives birth to her only son 'Sin' and enjoys happy days full of lighthearted traveling. Her happiness is interrupted, however, when a mysterious portal teleports her to the world of Hasla.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_GS_4_05_DESC.text: A Silver Rank adventurer proficient with a variety of spells, especially those of the earth element. Dwarf Shaman travels with High Elf Archer and Lizardman Priest to share the joys of adventuring with Goblin Slayer. While helping Goblin Slayer defeat Goblins as usual, the party discovers a Goblin Lord and his horde of Goblins teleporting through a magical mirror to another dimension. Goblin Slayer jumps through to chase after the Goblins without hesitation, and Dwarf Shaman has no choice but to follow him through the mirror.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_GS_5_05_DESC.text: A Silver Rank adventurer proficient with a variety of spells, especially those of the earth element. TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_OT_4_02_DESC.text: Age 30, male. A scholar teaching at the Royal Academy in Atlasdam, found in the Flatlands.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_OT_5_02_DESC.text: Although he has numerous admirers, his only true passion is the pursuit of knowledge.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_OT_6_02_DESC.text: 「There is so much more I would learn! 」 Then, one day, he realizes that an invaluable tome has vanished from the Royal Library.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_RZ_4_04_DESC.text: The older sister of the twin maids working at the Roswaal Mansion. While she has a sharp tongue and tends to do everything at her own pace, she has a good eye and can quickly distinguish and evaluate the situation when necessary. In her childhood, Ram was acknowledged as a child prodigy of the 'Oni' race, but in an ambush by the Witch Cult 10 years ago, her horn was cut off and she lost most of her magical powers.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_RZ_4_05_DESC.text: A Half Elf with beautiful silver hair who has been unfairly discriminated against and feared for her striking resemblance to the Witch of Envy, Satella. For this reason, she refuses to step into Irlam Village, in which the mansion of her benefactor 'Roswaal' stands, and always wears a cloak that hides her identity from suspicious eyes.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_RZ_4_06_DESC.text: A young girl who lives in and takes care of the secret library of Roswaal Mansion. She uses a particular magic called 'Door Crossing' to connect the door of the library to another in the mansion. Despite her apparent hermitage, she sometimes strolls out of the library to eat or take a short walk.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_RZ_5_04_DESC.text: The older sister of the twin maids working at the Roswaal Mansion. While she has a sharp tongue and tends to do everything at her own pace, she has a good eye and can quickly distinguish and evaluate the situation when necessary. TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_SH_4_04_DESC.text: The Queen of Filolials. Fitoria instinctively senses that the oncoming Waves of Destruction pose a greater threat than before and departs to find the Shield Hero in order to help protect the world. The Rift of Dimensions, however, suddenly opens before her and swallows her up, carrying her across into a strange new world.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_SH_4_05_DESC.text: The Fan Hero, a Vassal Hero from another world than that of the four Legendary Heroes. In order to protect her beloved world from the Waves of Destruction, Glass must bear the task of destroying the world of the four Legendary Heroes. She travels through the Rift of Dimensions in order to battle Naofumi and his comrades, but is unexpectedly carried away to another dimension by the power of a tremendous crack between the worlds.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_SH_4_06_DESC.text: After being rescued by Itsuki the Bow Hero, Rishia joined his party to show her gratitude and respect. However, she is treated as nothing more than an errand girl by Itsuki and his companions due to her apparent weakness. Rishia still endeavors to help Itsuki by preparing for the oncoming Waves of Destruction, but when a crack in the dimension suddenly appears before her, she is sucked into the Rift of Dimensions onto another world.

TEXT_CHA_WI_LIMITED_SH_5_04_DESC.text: The Queen of Filolials. Fitoria instinctively senses that the oncoming Waves of Destruction pose a greater threat than before and departs to find the Shield Hero in order to help protect the world.
